2.descriptionId: Erty Trapchet forgot to look after his plants, you have to go to his place and water them.

3.descriptionId: Erty Trapchet would like to study some dandelion seeds to compare them with some Epyss.

4.descriptionId: For his research, Trapchet needs to study the geographical distribution of the flowers around Astrub.

5.nameId: The Good, the Bad and the Flora
5.descriptionId: Three-Flower, a friend of Trapchet, lives in Amakna and knows the flora of the area thoroughly. Go ask him for some information about the aggressive flowers in this area.

6.nameId: Some Mimilk for a Bow Meow
6.descriptionId: Take some Mimilk to the miserable Bow Meow.

7.descriptionId: Ask the people you meet what a medium-sized Bow Meow eats. Then take a bit of food to this Bow Meow.

8.descriptionId: Take the Bow Meow for a walk around town.

9.descriptionId: Find out how to make a hero out of this frail Bow Meow in the eyes of its companion.

10.descriptionId: Take some Arachnee legs to the jeweller, she needs them for her amulets.

11.descriptionId: Take some Gobball Slobber to Shani Sings.

12.descriptionId: Shani forgot to bring enough mush mush thorns for tomorrow's test. Go and get some more.

13.descriptionId: Shani has given you a ring with latent powers. To activate them, you'll have to kill a Treechnid.

20.descriptionId: Ogivol Scalarcin's expecting you. You can get to his den through a trapdoor hidden in the grounds of the timber yard.

21.descriptionId: You suddenly feel the need to learn more about yourself and decide to go to a blood-drenched place - the butcher's.

22.descriptionId: Find Ztiv Oztin and offer him your services...

23.descriptionId: Eilof wants a Twiggy Shovel to build his anti-apocalypse shelter.

24.descriptionId: Find a way to get the spy report and take it to Ztiv Oztin.

25.descriptionId: Your master heard that a worker at the mine was recently turned into a Dark Miner. He wants to know the whole story.

26.descriptionId: The baker has four urgent deliveries to make. Go drop off the cakes as quickly as possible.

27.descriptionId: To build his indestructible shelter, Eilof asks for two chestnut tree planks and a few loaves of bread. That should keep him going for at least three days after the apocalypse!

28.descriptionId: Check if the deliverer Looc Drif is really sick.

29.descriptionId: Find someone both strong and nimble to replace the old deliverer.

30.descriptionId: Go and deliver the cake to grandma.

31.descriptionId: The One-armed Bandits' camp is in the north of the forest of Astrub, one of them probably has the stuffed toy.

32.nameId: Whoever Sows the Wynd Shall Reap the Whirlwynd
32.descriptionId: To test his theory about the emergence of carnivorous flowers, Trapchet wants you to sow some dark rose seeds and harvest the plants.

33.descriptionId: You have to collect Linen flowers for Kry Babby's mother. Only alchemists can pluck these flowers.

34.descriptionId: Don Eaddat the shepherd has problems with a hairy beast. He's looking for someone who can tell him more about the creature.

35.descriptionId: Abrazelon Sixgriffe said the Bearman was able to control very powerful creatures. Before you set off to find him, you'll have to inform Don Eaddat of your discovery.

36.descriptionId: You have to follow the bear's footsprints all the way to its lair..

37.descriptionId: According to Abrazelon, the Bearman will only use his parchment if several people attack him. You'll also have to take it to him so he can authenticate it.

41.descriptionId: The Enutrofs have discovered something and they're going to need your help.

44.descriptionId: You must find some Dizbi flowers if you want your class master to make a staff worthy of its name.

45.descriptionId: Find Howard the Yeahbutno and give him Joe Stonefiddler's letter.

46.descriptionId: The flower won't do as it is; you should make tea with it!

47.descriptionId: You have to take the tea to your guild master so that a staff can be made. If it's possible and if you have time, take some tea to your florist as well, it will make them very happy.

49.descriptionId: Go and get help from the Fecas and Eniripsas.

51.descriptionId: File your report with Joe to get your reward.

52.descriptionId: Alit the tailor needs some black and white Gobbly wool. If you take some to him, he will probably make something just right for you.

53.descriptionId: Alit recommends you to add a lining to your cape. But to do this, you'll have to bring him some Gobball wool.

54.nameId: All That Fuss for an Earmuff!
54.descriptionId: Bring the materials needed to make an earmuff. Some of them will be hard to get, you may have to ask for some help.

55.descriptionId: Wogew needs you to extract the blood of a particular Wabbit using a syringe.

57.descriptionId: Somebody needs to analyse the GM Wabbit's blood sample.

58.descriptionId: Now all you have to do is take the blood analysis back to Wogew.

61.descriptionId: Take the bag full of suspect kamas to someone who will be able to make something interesting out of them.

63.descriptionId: Take the sword back to your guild master. He will imprint your class insignia on it.

67.nameId: How to Forge a Sword' for Dummies
67.descriptionId: You need a blacksmith to create a sword.

68.nameId: The Utility of a Good Hilt
68.descriptionId: Find a hilt to get your sword forged.

69.descriptionId: Take the newly forged sword to your master.

70.descriptionId: Louc has to solve his chest problem and get ready for his first date at the same time. Go and get him two roses, one for each girl.

71.descriptionId: Look carefully at the pebbles and compare them to those found in Louc's house. To do this, you have to check all the suspicious spots.

72.descriptionId: The pebbles come from near the mines north-east of the village. You'll find Louc's chest up there.

73.descriptionId: You think you like children? You haven't met this little brat yet!

74.descriptionId: Just like the basement of every library, it's full of all kinds of books and arachnee cobwebs. However, in this one, there's also some kind of special, mysterious atmosphere.

75.descriptionId: Haa.. your first bow, how nice!

76.nameId: The Necessity of Being Able to Use It
76.descriptionId: Attacking a few insects is a good way of learning how to handle your new weapon.

80.descriptionId: A hidden door in the mountain gives access to an underpass. But you still have to figure out how.

81.descriptionId: A slab set high up in the mountain and a hidden door. Volunteers will be needed to get to the end of this gallery.

87.descriptionId: Tek Abir, the village innkeeper, is compelled to water down his beer because he's losing profits to thieves. Go up the road to the deliverer south-west and escort him on his way.

88.descriptionId: Put an end to the beer robbery.

90.descriptionId: Gather various resources to help Kwartzwatch see into the future.

91.nameId: The Future's Bright, the Future's Blue?
91.descriptionId: Kwartzwatch needs a Blue Larva skin to put the finishing touches to her machine.

92.nameId: What's to Come Is not Fun!
92.descriptionId: Kwartzwatch will tell you more about your near future.

93.descriptionId: Help your guild master to find a cure for the Tofus.

94.descriptionId: Take the remedy you got to Clint Pot. Don't forget to file a report with your class master.

102.descriptionId: You need to find some Hurry Wood. By sacrificing nature, you will have the opportunity to create a bond with it.

103.descriptionId: Kry Babby forgot where her house is, she's scared to death and afraid to go to town on her own.

104.descriptionId: Find the person who'll help you make your initiate staff.

109.descriptionId:
Ogivol has been seen around the Brakmar City Walls. He's wanted for stealing a whole host of things, especially secret documents. 
He's been sentenced to imprisonment in Astrub.

111.descriptionId: Akornaddikt is wandering through the city in search of succulent acorns to sink his teeth into.

113.descriptionId:
He's been seen near the Sidimote Moors. He is wanted for going against the cosmic order. 
Brumen Tinctorias is sentenced to imprisonment in Astrub.

115.descriptionId:
Qil Bil has been seen near the Sidimote plains.
He is wanted for pulling out human limbs and is sentenced to imprisonment in Astrub.

118.descriptionId: Allisteria's Gobballs are hungry and they all need to be fed!

119.descriptionId:
Stellia Blutzell has been seen near the One-armed Bandits village.
She's wanted for stealing haemoglobin and has been sentenced to imprisonment in Astrub.

121.descriptionId: Nomarow Transplent might be up north-west of the Cania Plains, near the Eltneg wood. He's been sentenced to imprisonment in Astrub for hurting domestic Gobballs and for kicking up a row late at night.

127.descriptionId: Your objective: Save the good Stewed Black Gobball Pudding tradition.

132.descriptionId: The famous Fallanster has asked you to train his daughter in the art of combat.

133.descriptionId: Raih Resserd needs a pair of forged scissors, she advises you to go and see the blacksmith at the market to buy some.

134.descriptionId: Raih is trying to gather as many types of hair as she can from the different inhabitants of Astrub, so that she can make wigs with it.

135.descriptionId: The Enutrofs, who have gone in search of Sniffallrats, probably got lost deep in the underpasses. The place is infested with Grossewer Milirats..

139.descriptionId: Collect 10 Sick Arachnees for Ant Emicheun. Or for yourself, whatever you like. In any case you'll make a tidy profit.

140.descriptionId: You can make a nice feather duster with 20 feathers. Mind you, given the state of these pathetic things.

141.descriptionId: No more disease in the sick Tofu feathers. On the other hand their eggs would probably be useful to the Eniripsa. Another few kamas to be earned!

142.descriptionId: The Cras are getting out while the going's good, or, more accurately, their arrows are. It seems sick Arachnee legs are used for making poison. Oh well, business is business.

143.descriptionId: Some dark creatures are ruining Ant Emicheun's business. The best solution would be to get rid of them, at least until he can understand what they're doing there.

144.descriptionId: The Xelors seem to be particularly interested in sharp toothy-pegs. According to Ant, they want to use them as hands for their sandglasses... or something, but he's not really sure. Go hunt some Milirats to complete your mission.

145.descriptionId: Raih will be delighted to see the brand new scissors you've picked up.

146.nameId: A Bird in the Hand Is Worth Two Rats in the Bush
146.descriptionId: Get rid of the Grossewer Rat. It shouldn't be that difficult, I think it's sick. I'd bring a few friends along all the same, though.

147.descriptionId: Go to grandma's cellar and take care of the threat.

148.descriptionId: Speak to grandma again and show her the Moumouse head.

150.descriptionId: Go back to Looc Drif's house to get your reward.

153.nameId: Let the Sun Shine in Pandala!
153.descriptionId: Upon your arrival in Pandala, you must put your papers in order with the administration. Plus, you'll have to pay the dreaded McSheth levy.

154.descriptionId: Find a travelling seller. Here, you'll be able to pay the McSheth levy. Do not hesitate to strongly insist, they may not admit it at first, but they like it really.

155.descriptionId: Request help to the Shaman! Hurry!

156.descriptionId: The Enutrof having a cure by the Shaman advise you to visit Grandapan. He is really knowledgeable about the local folklore and the Pandawaiians legends

157.descriptionId: Grandapan gladly accepted the Enutrofs' gift. As an ardent admirer of the Dofus hunters, he gives you a warm welcome.

158.descriptionId: Thanks to your help, the Shaman assistant can start the thank-you ritual to the Goddess. He will be ready right after you offer him a traditional padawaiian gift.

159.descriptionId: A Pandawaiian soft drink saleswoman advises you to talk to Lenald the Wise. According to her, he is the only one to know the truth about Pandala and its mysteries.

160.nameId: It Is Forbidden to Sell Water to People Under the Age Of...
160.descriptionId: The water way consists of avoiding any water, either by absorption or submersion (partly or totally submerged), not drinking deliberately or washing yourself (except if extremely necessary). Find the master of the water way: he knows more than he lets on.

161.descriptionId: At Terrdala, no one is available to take the raw materials to the shieldsmith's workshop. Forging shield is essential for the Pandawa warriors. Fortunately you're here to do the job!

162.descriptionId: Lenald the Wise asks you to go to Aerdala Village, or maybe Terrdala; impossible to really understand with such a freaky accent! Once you're there, talk to the Master Pandawushu.

163.descriptionId: Beware of Dreggons! You'll have to cross their territory to access this new cave.

164.descriptionId: This underpass might drive you crazy!

165.nameId: Who's Afraid of the Big Bad Bow Meow?
165.descriptionId: Poochan is looking for her future husband but the only clues she has are that he lives in Pandala and he is scared of Bow Meows. The easiest thing to do would be to turn yourself into a Bow Meow and jump on everyone, wouldn't it?

166.descriptionId: Here, the tradition tells that the father decides who his son or his daughter will marry. You just have to persuade the father to let his son go. You will have to do your best to convince him.

167.descriptionId: In order to free Lanma from his duties, you will have to break off his engagement to a young lady in the Dento family.

168.descriptionId: To thank you for the delivery, the shield smith offers you a gift: a small training shield. Talk to the Dojo master for a training.

169.descriptionId: The messenger of Lenald the Wise wants you to go to the edge of the village of Aerdala. On your way, you think about his last words: Many adventurers weren't friendly welcome at Aerdala. It is said people there are allied to the Pandawa rebels who sabotage all accesses to the Island.

170.descriptionId: A messenger has a message, talk to him!

171.descriptionId: You don't seem to be welcome in Aerdala. Will you be able to get out of this troubling situation?

175.descriptionId: At last! You're nearly there! Yet the surprises still aren't over... The Lenald on Cawwot Island will reveal something that has been kept secret until now.

176.descriptionId: Purify your soul and wash your ears: Lenald the Wise is going to tell you the truth about Pandala's Dofus.

177.descriptionId: Freshly arrived at Pandala, the Shaman assistant requests you to be a credit to your Goddess: a spiritual offertory would be really kind of you... Your initiation can start.

179.descriptionId: The Shaman is a Pandawa who knows a lot about the schemes of some people... It seems it's no bed of roses in Pandala!

180.descriptionId: You have to show up on Saturday to pass the Ikwa level evaluation.

181.descriptionId: You have to show up on Saturday to pass the Nikwa level evaluation.

182.descriptionId: You have to show up on Saturday to pass the Sankwa level evaluation.

183.descriptionId: You have to show up on Saturday to pass the Yonkwa level evaluation.

184.descriptionId: You have to show up on Saturday to pass the Gokwa level evaluation.

185.descriptionId: You have to show up on Saturday to take the Rokwa level evaluation. Don't forget to wear your training outfit throughout the test!

187.descriptionId: Before you start the training, you have to get a shamanic certificate and a Pandawushuka outfit.

188.nameId: In the Temple of Your God
188.descriptionId: Following Lenald the Wise's advice, you plan your next expedition. You need to visit the temple of your god in Amakna.

192.descriptionId: The Shaman is extremely busy and has no time to allocate to you. The Pandikazes, the sickness of the Enutrofs and these are only two problems he has to deal with among thousand of others... If you want to help him, he advises you to talk to Pyrite, a quarantined Enutrof.

193.descriptionId: Grandapan gladly accepted the Enutrofs' gift. As an ardent admirer of the Dofus hunters, he gives you a warm welcome. In order to satisfy your explorer's curiosity, he takes you to the Dofus receptacle.

194.nameId: A Drink in Hand Is Worth Two in a Bush
194.descriptionId: The Water Way consists of resisting the intake of, or submersion in, water (either partially or totally) - by any means. Do not ever drink it. Only wash yourself in extreme need. Find the Master of the Water Way: he knows more than he's letting on.

195.descriptionId: Brakmarians have destroyed Bontarian lofts.You must find a way to resupply the mounts of the militia. Pay Merlinmagus a visit at the Alchemists' Workshop, he will help you find a solution.

196.descriptionId: After the fire in the food lofts in Brakmar, Ebru Of El wants to know what their enemies are up to.

197.descriptionId: Elviana Tirips wants to question Bontarian renegades but before he must resuscitate them.

198.descriptionId: Shush wonders what's going on in Bonta. He sends you over there to contact the spy Finche Aticus.

199.descriptionId: Divad cannot resuscitate Terra Bitya to question her. You've been entrusted with the mission to improvise a resurrecting spell which can do it.

200.descriptionId: Since Brakmarian agents are useless, Kaffra asked you to go to Astrub and convince the Bontarian merchant Raymond Santho to resupply Brakmar.

201.descriptionId:
Rok was spotted North of Pandala.
He's been sentenced to prison in Astrub.

202.descriptionId:
Musha was spotted South of Pandala. 
He's been sentenced to prison in Astrub.

203.descriptionId:
Marzwel was spotted near Aerdala. 
He's been sentenced to prison in Astrub.

204.descriptionId:
Zatoishwan was spotted near Terrdala. 
He's been sentenced to prison in Astrub.

206.descriptionId:
Aermyne was spotted near Terrdala. 
She's been sentenced to prison in Astrub.

207.descriptionId: Take the fake Dofus to Grandapan.

208.descriptionId: Shush Tercesasti wants to lay his hands on the Statues of Sumens. He's ordered you to capture their keeper.

209.descriptionId: Terra Bitya has finally been resuscitated. Now, you must convince her to reveal her secret to you.

210.nameId: Impossible Is Nothing to a Bleeding Heart
210.descriptionId: You must seize the statues - symbols of all the goods and evils of humanity - and give them to Kaffra. They're hidden in an abandoned mine near the Enutrof Temple.

211.descriptionId: Only eight courageous adventurers will be able to get to the end of this underpass!

212.descriptionId: Take two Tofu Eggs to Nowa.

213.descriptionId: The Magus Ax should be able to analyse the Tofu eggs and the Dofus.

214.nameId: The Mercenary Chief and the Enutrof
214.descriptionId: Igor Ant knows what the Dofawa dealers get up to.

215.descriptionId: Acidrik can read your future in the head of a good beer.

216.descriptionId: This book is entitled dragon era and not Dragon Era.

217.nameId: Take a Purple Piwi Feather to Acidrik
217.descriptionId: Acidrik needs a Piwi feather to free his book from Herdegrize's plagiarism spell.

218.descriptionId: Be sure to remember the symbol engraved on the god's hammer.

219.descriptionId: Here, you'll find a response from Menalt's soul.

221.descriptionId: Astrub's prisoners are restless. A mercenary asks if you could help him keep watch over the louts.

222.descriptionId: Guti Outsider would like to take you on a visit around the renovated castle and its harbour.

224.descriptionId: Take some Ash Planks to the Site Chief so that he can finish the roof of Allister's Castle.

225.nameId: Rocks to Fill in the Holes
225.descriptionId: Take some Flint to the Site Chief so he can finish the walls of Allister's Castle.

226.descriptionId: Take some wheat to the Site Chief so he can feed his workers.

227.descriptionId: Take some larva pieces to the Site Chief so he can feed his workers.

228.descriptionId: The Site Chief wants to impress his future fiance with a nice, well-filled table.

229.descriptionId: The Site Chief wants an engagement ring.

230.descriptionId: The Site Chief wants to invite Monabella to diner to ask her to become his fiance.

231.nameId: The Site Chief Falls Back on Wartella
231.descriptionId: He invites Wartella to share his dinner.

232.nameId: The Site Chief Prefers to Have a Drink With a Friend
232.descriptionId: All you need to enjoy a nice evening is beer and a friend.

233.descriptionId: You brought the prisoners of Astrub to heel. Talk to Edgg Komb about it.

234.descriptionId: Go back to Nistracolamus to discover what this famous symbol means.

235.descriptionId: Wartella is looking for a shark.

236.descriptionId: Wartella wants me to chase the Showk out of the port.

237.descriptionId: The shark gave kamas to Wartella.

239.descriptionId: Sharkham is happy with the turn of events.

240.nameId: Ingredients to Make a Bootlicker Potion
240.descriptionId: You'll need a Gobball War Chief Horn, an Evil Rose Petal, a Gutted Kralove and a Poppy Seed to make a good Bootlicker Potion.

241.nameId: Bootlicker Potion for a Lapping Pest
241.descriptionId: You must deliver this potion to Monabella.

242.nameId: Bootlicker Potion for a Juicy Business
242.descriptionId: Haraquiri might want this potion for his business with Allister.

243.descriptionId: Walt Apain needs to drink beer before he goes face the shark.

244.descriptionId: Walt Apain has a big headache as he kept on mixing beers.

245.descriptionId: The docker will need to drink a beer or too to cheer up.

246.descriptionId: Monabella would like to take over a con's old hideout to fit it out to her taste.

247.descriptionId: Monabella wants a remote house, far away from court.

248.nameId: Mount and Oil for the Holidays
248.descriptionId: Monabella needs a Dragoturkey and some Sunflower Oil to go relax in the sun in her future straw hut.

249.nameId: A Bow Meow for a Pest
249.descriptionId: Monabella wants a White Bow Meow and it seems that a certain Pandikaze has a whole litter of them.

250.descriptionId: You'll have to deliver potato bags to the prison of the port.

251.descriptionId: Bhen Neddal would like to grow his own potatoes for his personal pleasure.

252.descriptionId: Bhen Neddal wants you to thank Rocco Fidelio for his potatoes.

253.descriptionId: Haraquiri, Allister's official butcher, needs warm young flesh.

259.descriptionId: The King likes to ride. You must find him Dragoturkeys.

260.descriptionId: Supply the militia with some fresh young mounts.

261.descriptionId: The militiaman didn't beat around the bush. He wants Dragoturkeys! And quick!

262.descriptionId: Ploddey, the map maker is too old to make such a trip.

263.descriptionId: Orchids grow in the Koalak Mountains. You'll need to bring back a good lot for Maskara.

264.descriptionId: Koka Dekolak needs several specific raw materials.

265.descriptionId: Koka Dekolak wants some more specific resources. You'll find them in the Koalak region.

266.descriptionId: Koka needs your harvesting talent once again.

267.descriptionId: Show your determination to Gobballeater and win the Gobball Dungeon Key.

268.descriptionId: Metag the Warrior told you about a fantastically powerful relic. But you must show him your value as a warrior before you can continue.

269.descriptionId: The quest for the artefact has begun. Confront the monsters of the Field Dungeon.

270.descriptionId: Don't stop showing your determination: enter the Gobball Dungeon!

271.descriptionId: Don't stop showing your determination: take your carcass for a walk in the Skeleton Dungeon!

272.descriptionId: Don't stop showing your determination: the Tofu House is waiting for you...

273.descriptionId: Jumbo will be your umpire for this part of the quest.

274.descriptionId: Jumbo will be your umpire for this round.

278.descriptionId: Jumbo keeps on staring at you.

279.descriptionId: Jumbo Mumbo advised you to pay a visit to the next person who might be able to help you prove your value.

280.descriptionId: The Key Master sends you to visit one of his friends.

281.descriptionId: Metag agreed to test you. He's sending you to pay a visit to the mysterious Key Master.

282.descriptionId: Kris is slightly stressed. You'd better do what he asks pretty quickly.

283.descriptionId: Kris is not feeling any better. Hurry before his state worsens.

284.descriptionId: Despite his moods, Kris is really helping your relic hunt.

285.descriptionId: Kris is sending you to more and more dangerous places.

287.descriptionId: You understood that this would be your very last fight before victory came raining down upon you like a cat.

288.descriptionId: In spite of the long and hard fighting today, they were only a mere hiccup along the way.

289.descriptionId: Colm, a kind of machine, will help you continue your quest. At least this guy tells you what you have to do.

290.descriptionId: Colm couldn't transmit his message in full. But now you have the key, you can guess what you have to do.

291.descriptionId: Colm didn't fix his problem but you keep on going with your quest.

295.descriptionId: Colm is stuck but gives you the keys.

296.descriptionId: Colm gave you the very last key. You're close to the end.

297.descriptionId: Colm has nothing else to give you. Go back to the Key Master.

298.descriptionId: The master decided to impose you some more ordeals. This is getting boring.

299.descriptionId: The master believes you're a real instrument of warfare; there's another ordeal for you.

300.descriptionId: It seems like you won't be able to escape this endless list of massacres. But if that's what has to be done.

301.descriptionId: Almost there! The Key Master has entrusted you with one last ordeal.

302.descriptionId: You made it! It's finally over. Metamunch had better keep his promise. The ultimate Kin family relic is yours!

306.descriptionId: This time the master has sent you to check who has the biggest ones.

307.descriptionId: In this case, counting to three - no more, no less - will be no help at all.

308.descriptionId: Madam El is panic-stricken. She's looking for her children in the village of Amakna.

309.descriptionId: Villagers probably saw the El children. Question some of them to get some more information.

310.descriptionId: The young Jorg mentioned a secret hut in the Dragoturkey forest.

311.descriptionId: The cruel Paindep is threatening to devour the El children if she can't find anything better to eat. A famous chef, like Gordo McRamsay, might be able to help you. He's got a restaurant in Amakna.

312.descriptionId: The recipe for Filtounga is in your hands. All you need to do is gather all the ingredients for Gordo to prepare this famous dish.

313.descriptionId: Gordo the chef will make the recipe if you take all the necessary ingredients to him.

314.descriptionId: Gordo now has everything he needs to make a Filtounga. You just have to wait.

315.descriptionId: Gordo's Filtounga should now be ready.

316.descriptionId: Gordo has finished the Filtounga. Paindep should be happy!

319.descriptionId: Pinta Gone is looking for the recipe of the famous Bwork beer. He believes that it's in a strange room on the Bwork territory.

320.descriptionId: Raxitik is terrified. He knows that Bworks will take him to the Trool to play a Trool-playing game with him. You must kill the Trool that threatens Raxitik's physical integrity.

321.descriptionId: Gobatchef wants the Bworks to be killed before they kill the Goblins.

322.nameId: Krazybwork Wants to Become Dumb Again
322.descriptionId: Krazybwork ate too many Goblins during the Battle of Bworkdrift. He became intelligent and wants to be dumb again. The best method would be to hit him on the head!

324.descriptionId: Bworknroll needs pieces to create his ideal partner.

325.descriptionId: Bworknroll needs to fill his creature with fresh (and juicy) organs.

326.nameId: Don't Forget the Essential: the Mussel!
326.descriptionId: Bworknroll needs a mussel to finish his dream creature.

327.nameId: Pinta Gone Wants to Read the Recipe
327.descriptionId:
He already bought all the equipment to brew his beer. 
Only the recipe is missing.

328.descriptionId: Litol's father wants him to become a magus. Take him to the most powerful Bwork Magus with something to eat.

329.descriptionId: Struk'tohr Nhin has asked you to keep the surrounding areas safe... or, in other words, to massacre one of those beasts you see wandering about in the vicinity.

330.descriptionId: Bworkupine wants Goblin skins for his females.

331.descriptionId:
Bworkonductor needs to prove his virility to his sweet lovely wife asking for gifts to the travellers passing by in his charming village.
He hopes that a Prespic set will repel the rolling-pin blows of his beloved Bworkette.

332.descriptionId: Djaycy is a fantastic guy. It didn't take him long to figure out you can use wool to make... wool.

333.descriptionId: Shaa kwira is a Sacrier with a scary temperament. She wants you to fight some of the creatures that roam the surrounding areas.

334.descriptionId: Gobriel has had enough of the other Goblins throwing stones at him because of the colour of his skin. He would like to become an angel.

335.descriptionId: Chop down the trees, then take the logs to foreman Ikure.

336.descriptionId: That's where Pinkgob is locked up.

337.descriptionId: Bworkcine is ready to trade her slave for her weight in Bwork beer.

338.descriptionId: Will Pinkgob and Gobrator join together?

339.descriptionId: Gobrator is jealous of Pinkgob's Piwis. Only the vibrations of his little green Goblin heart can make that of Pinkgob beat.

340.descriptionId: Pinkgob prefers to be a slave and breed Piwis. What a sad reality for her suitor.

342.descriptionId: Babblera is waiting for the Astrub pancake recipe so that she can prepare something for her grand children.

343.descriptionId: Postor Nhin must have a job for you.

344.descriptionId: This time you have to deliver a tool to Xelorat Masket, the Zaap handywoman. Why not kill two birds with one stone and learn a bit about those strange magic doorways?

345.descriptionId: So that nothing disturbs the peace in Incarnam, you've been asked to make sure that all guards are doing their jobs.

346.descriptionId: Djaycy wants you to go and see Shaa Kwira. Better not get on his wrong side. Something bad might happen, like an apocalypse or a double impact or something.

347.descriptionId: Qwizitor wants to know if the people of Incarnam have noticed anything unusual.

351.descriptionId: If you want to learn more about the story of Iop's sword, go ask Danaida at the Temple.

352.descriptionId: Crippled Nhin wants you to take an Ash Plank to Poss'Ybel.

354.nameId: In the Line of Duty: Piwis and Boars
354.descriptionId: The captain entrusted you with an easy but useful task.

361.descriptionId: You have to add a player to your friend list.

362.descriptionId: Brett Ernal turned you into a ghost. Use the phoenix to get your strength back.

363.descriptionId: This vain Osamodas should be taught a lesson!

365.descriptionId: To get the Dungeon Key, you must defeat a big angry Gobball.

366.descriptionId: Brett wants Incarnam Lemonade. Why doesn't he go get it by himself?

367.descriptionId: You have the lemonade. If you give it to Brett, he'll give you your energy back.

368.nameId: In the Line of Duty: Tofus
368.descriptionId: The captain entrusted you with an easy but useful task.

369.nameId: In the Line of Duty: Gobball
369.descriptionId: The captain entrusted you with an easy but useful task.

370.nameId: In the Line of Duty: Arachnees
370.descriptionId: The captain entrusted you with an easy but useful task.

371.descriptionId: Onmast'her challenged you to defeat the monster hidden in the kennel.

372.descriptionId: Despite his weird accent, you perfectly understood what Marylork asked you.

373.descriptionId: Lykhen tells you about his adventures long ago.

374.descriptionId: Bworknroll accepted to teach magic to Litol. Go and tell his father.

375.descriptionId: Litol has agreed to follow you. Don't forget to bring his Troofle, his Fattrool and the Red Cape.

376.descriptionId: If Bworknroll accepts the payment, Litol will be able to become a magus.

378.descriptionId: Crippled Nhin wants you to take a healing potion made from Flax Flowers and a bit of water to Poss'Ybel.

379.descriptionId: Crippled Nhin wants you to take a few bags of wheat you've harvested yourself to Poss'Ybel.

380.descriptionId: Crippled Nhin wants you to take a Gutted Gudegon to Poss'Ybel.

381.descriptionId: Go and pick some flowers, then take your harvest to foreman Ikure.

382.descriptionId: Harvest the wheat fields, then take your crop to foreman Ikure.

383.descriptionId: Cast your hook into the water, then take all your best catches to foreman Ikure.

384.descriptionId: Yse Vewybad told you about an important Sram in Amakna... But where do we find Sram in Amakna?

385.descriptionId: Yse Vewybad gave you details about the Rogues' location. Go and see near the cemetery.

386.descriptionId: You must visit the five crypts in Amakna cemetery.

387.descriptionId: You continue your search to try and flush out the Rogue Chief.

388.descriptionId: You have to infiltrate the Rogues and speak with Vil Smisse.

390.descriptionId: Now, you know that Yse Vewybad is conspiring against the King. You'll have to choose your side.

394.descriptionId: You have to find a suitor for Allisteria, the king's brother's daughter.

395.descriptionId: Vil Smisse wants you to gather information about what is going on in the castle. Therefore, you must find someone able to tell you more about this.

396.descriptionId: Now you know that the King must marry his niece... but to whom?

399.descriptionId: You'll have to find a way to turn yourself into a Wabbit. Vil Smisse mentioned a potion and, as far as you know, potions are made by alchemists. There must be an alchemist somewhere who can help you...

400.descriptionId: You have to find alchemists dispersed in Amakna.

401.nameId: Got the Recipe, Now for the Ingredients!
401.descriptionId: Now that Uba has the formula, he only needs the ingredients.

402.descriptionId: As you can see, Uba Tesse transformed you into a Wabbit. All that remains is to go to the castle and ruin this wedding.

403.descriptionId: Vil Smisse asked you to bring him an obese Tofu egg. All you need to do is find the nest...

404.descriptionId: You have the obese Tofu egg but an egg will not harm the prince... You have to find something to force-feed the young bird it holds.

405.descriptionId: Vil Smisse chose to play the Rogue way: the slyness.

406.descriptionId: Vil Smisse will not be able to use the poison Rasputin Cake. He then falls back on the direct attack. For that, he wants to hire assassins and he needs money.

407.descriptionId: The assassins didn't manage to kill the prince... Vil Smisse asks you to go and hire a Lenald to do the job.

408.descriptionId: You know where the Prince of Wa went to hunt. Well, more or less... The south of Cania was mentioned. You have to convince the famous prince to marry Allisteria.

409.nameId: Follow Me If You Love Me!
409.descriptionId: The Prince of Wa has asked you to set up an escort of servants worthy of accompanying him... In view of his fighting abilities, his particular diet and his sense of aestheticism, he needs at least four people to assist him. Go and recruit some inhabitants of Bonta. You'll also need to find a good chef, and if you want someone with enough culinary flair to surprise and delight the Prince's palate, best to try around Brakmar. Finally, why not add someone known around Pandala, for a little touch of exoticism?

414.descriptionId: Steward San Lavalss asked you to help to prepare the wedding.

415.descriptionId: The Prince of Wa is being attacked. Protect him!

416.descriptionId: The Prince of Wa asked you to take his place to unmask the assassins. But you first need to find someone able to transform you into a Wabbit.

417.descriptionId: Now that the formula is complete, you need the ingredients.

420.descriptionId: Emeralda is desperately looking for a Koalak Set.

421.descriptionId: The Death Bridge Keeper demands that you answer his questions correctly.

422.descriptionId: Captain Haddock'n'roll has asked you to bring him several items so that you can board his ship.

423.descriptionId: The Captain Haddock'n'roll miserably beached on Castaway Island. You must find the Flib's Cursed Chest and a few items to fix the ship.

424.descriptionId: The Black and Pink Knight won't let you through. It might be a good time to use strength to get what you want.

425.descriptionId: The Professor Kalkulus needs a Bulbish Potion to start working again.

426.descriptionId: Polka Merer needs breeding machines for her creatures.

427.descriptionId: Stella Stukup, the baker, wants to add up other cheaper flours to that of Xavier the Baker. She had the idea, now you find the flours!

428.descriptionId: The Doctor Nauh lost his son in a lab filled with wild terrible creatures. You must find him and make sure that he's still alive!

429.descriptionId: Poor Doctor Morose lost his wife. Help him find her in the Dark Jungle and try to convince her to get back to her husband so that the latter can start his researches again.

430.descriptionId: Speet Fyer is looking for an improved pilot helmet and cape. Only an experienced tailor will be able to help you out.

431.nameId: Two Wild Dragoturkeys for Flip Flap
431.descriptionId: Flip Flap would like you to bring her a certificate for a Wild Ginger Dragoturkey and one for a Wild Almond Dragoturkey.

432.descriptionId: Crocodyl Dandy would like you to kill some creatures on the Coral Beach.

433.descriptionId: Crocodyl Dandy would like you to hunt several Plain creatures.

434.descriptionId: Crocodyl Dandy would like you to hunt a few creatures from the Bottomless Peat Bog.

435.descriptionId: Crocodyl Dandy would like you to hunt a few creatures from the Dark Jungle.

436.descriptionId: Crocodyl Dandy would like you to hunt a few creatures from the Tree Keeholo.

437.descriptionId: Kito asked you to show Pirates what you can do. This should serve as an example for the others who would feel like throwing cannonballs.

438.descriptionId: Miss Lousy Piggy would like you to confront the terrible Black and Pink Knight for her.

440.descriptionId: Farle Ingalsse is probably the only person in Amakna capable of fixing your cursed sword.

442.descriptionId: You must find in Bonta a very important person who is said to be corrupt. Oto suggested you go search in the Tower.

443.descriptionId: You found an interesting piece of paper and must go back and show it to Oto.

444.descriptionId: You must find information about Xephires. Bontarian innkeepers may be able to help you.

445.descriptionId: You've brought back interesting information to Oto Mustam. He asked you to take over a militiaman. Go to the Treechnid Forest and look for a Sram who knows Xephires.

446.descriptionId: Exoram feels unsafe. He heard weird noises and evil laughs to the north. If you could assure him that road is clear, he would give you precious information about Xephires.

447.nameId: Goblin or not Goblin, That Is the Question
447.descriptionId: From what you've discovered Exoram has been made prisoner by Goblins and is in their camp. Unless he's already dead.

448.descriptionId: Exoram was set free by the Goblins. You must go look for and find him.

449.descriptionId: The message of the thieves' chief helped you find their hideout. Why don't you go and check it out before returning to the militia?

451.descriptionId: Now that you've discovered where Xephires is, you must go to the Drunken Pandawa Inn and make him an offer. He's there as of 4:00 pm.

452.descriptionId: Xephires rejected your offer, but all hope is not lost. You may get to what you want with a jewel. Pay a visit to the jeweller, Milone, he can help you.

453.descriptionId: You must gather certain ingredients to make a jewel including 5 Gold Ingot, 1 Royal Gobball Slobber and 1 Mother of Pearl. You can get Mother of Pearl by polishing 10 Raw Mothers of Pearl that can be found on shellfish and mollusks from Otomai Island.

455.descriptionId: You must kidnap Sabine and put her somewhere she won't be able to escape from.

456.descriptionId: Milone's house is about to be broken into. Hurry and stop this!

457.descriptionId: Since you couldn't stop the burglary at Milone's house, he asked you to bring him some Feudala Getas.

458.descriptionId: You must find a way to pass the letter on to Xephires. He is often at the Drunken Pandawa Inn, but refuses to talk to you.

459.descriptionId: Everything's ready. You just have to find Xephires in the Drunken Pandawa Inn, give him the letter and make an appointment for his answer.

460.descriptionId: Xephires accepts the conditions and is ready to betray Bonta when the moment comes. Oto will be delighted to hear the news.

461.descriptionId: The local wine dealer has disappeared. The Innkeeper Bagrutte may have some information.

462.descriptionId: According to Bagrutte, the merchant was in the habit of heading home, a little further to the east.

463.descriptionId: The Bandit who owned this sword probably visited one of the Inns. As a result, the Innkeepers must know something.

464.descriptionId: Amayiro has asked you to investigate north of the Cania Massif to find the bandits' hideout. From what you know, it shouldn't be far from the Trool Fair, a little to the west.

465.descriptionId: The bandits you met told you that Hersa Dark Claw knows more than what she pretends. Now go talk to her but stay away from her claws.

466.descriptionId: Your mission if you accept it is to escort a group of Cheeka merchants to Astrub.

468.descriptionId: Amayiro wants to set an ambush for the bandits. But he needs a valuable jewel to attract them.

469.descriptionId: The journey went well. Bandits didn't attack. Amayiro is waiting for your report.

470.descriptionId: The convoy was attacked by Ecaflip bandits who looked a lot like the ones whose camp you discovered. Amayiro is waiting for your report so he can convince the council to take action.

472.descriptionId: Under the council's pressure, Amaryio deprived you of your investigation. You are in charge of supplies now.

473.descriptionId: In the Sram temple, Rigal Hookhand is well-known for having lots of information. Information has a price. You just have to figure out how much is your.

474.descriptionId: You must find Brakmar's poison supplies and steal the client register from the Alchemists' Workshop. Bishom Pot may be able to help you.

475.descriptionId: Xarthan is not home. Seize the opportunity to search his house. You'll need a competent handyman to come with you.

476.descriptionId: Amayiro suspects Brakmar to be the origin of Bonta's problems. As a militia spy in Brakmar, Bishom Pot might have learnt something.

477.descriptionId: According to Bishom Pot, Milone Corichel - Brakmar's jeweller - knows something.

478.descriptionId: A meeting between a Brakmarian and a bribed Bontarian is about to take place in the Tower of Bonta. You must capture both of them if possible.

479.descriptionId: A fight is taking place next to Cania Bay, right between Bonta and Brakmar. You must join in to help Brakmar win.

480.descriptionId: The fight is over. Oto Mustam is waiting for your report.

481.descriptionId: Oto wants to have Kaffra Keeper's opinion regarding his offense plan against Bonta.

482.descriptionId: Sneak into the Bontarian Militia and discover where your enemies are storing their weapons.

483.nameId: My, What a Lovely Big Crate
483.descriptionId: Distract the guardian and take his warehouse keys. Then, steal the crate of equipment and take it to Mulic Bere to assess.

485.descriptionId: The spies hiding in the southwest of Bonta have need of poison - a special, rare poison that only the Bwork Magi posess.

486.descriptionId: You can now enter the library to take care of the tactician.

487.descriptionId: The spies failed in their murderous mission, so you'll have to do it for them. The target is a tactician who lives in the library of Bonta.

488.descriptionId: You've taken care of the tactician, so head back to Oto.

489.descriptionId: The tactician left town so you can easily make Oto believe that you killed him.

490.descriptionId: The tactician agrees to follow you to Brakmar.

491.descriptionId: Several Brakmarian warriors fell and were left for dead on the road to Astrub. You must go investigate. Oto Mustam wants a Whitish Fang soul.

492.descriptionId: Oto thinks that Bonta gets help from a mercenary blacksmith. You must investigate in the blacksmiths' and miners' workshops to find evidence.

493.descriptionId: Oto wants to rally the blacksmith from the Porcos' cave to the Brakmarian cause.

494.descriptionId: A weapons convoy will pass the edge of the Treechnid Forest on its way to the Imps Village. Intercept it. Reinforcements are advisable.

495.descriptionId: Thanks to Xephires, you now know that the Bontarian ship The Panta Maria is carrying many magical items in her hold. Find the ship and plunder her wares.

496.descriptionId: There's a fight taking place near Cania Bay, on the road at the halfway point between Bonta and Brakmar. You must join in to help Bonta win.

497.descriptionId: The fight is over. Justfa Lafs is waiting for your report.

498.descriptionId: Do some digging on the guy who supplies the militia's equipment, and confront the smith who produces it.

499.descriptionId: You must find a skilled blacksmith who will agree to make the equipment for Bonta. Amayiro suggests that you go search in the workshops (either those of blacksmiths or miners).

500.descriptionId: Norb knows where you can find the hermit smith; now all you need to do is get him to spill the beans about his hiding place! Maybe Amayiro will be able to help.

501.descriptionId: Nara has asked you to find him a quiet place where he can set up his forge and his equipment.

502.nameId: Lenglad Is in for a New Session
502.descriptionId: William Lenglad needs to be taught another lesson.

503.descriptionId: In the Porcos' mine, Nara the blacksmith needs 20 unit of silver, 20 unit of Ebony wood and a tool which can be found in Norb's workshop.

504.descriptionId: Danathor seems to have a new offer to put to you. But it's probably a shady one.

508.descriptionId: Danathor needs your services again to find the Bwork Magus spellbook said to contain the Grafioze curse.

509.nameId: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
509.descriptionId: Amayairo wants to set an ambush for the Brakmarians to test the new equipment and the cohesion of the militimen.

510.descriptionId: Amayiro is worried the Brakmarians may strike very soon. You must find their plan of attack, so Amayiro can prepare the welcoming party.

512.descriptionId: Rumour has it there exists a horn with strong magic powers. The inhabitants of Sufokia have more information about it.

513.descriptionId: The keeper of the Ripate Inn wants you to bring him turtle carapaces from Moon - one in each colour. Maybe a large sum of kamas would work instead, though.

514.descriptionId: The so-called guardian of the Fogornleg Horn is in the depths of the Moon Island jungle. According to the rumours, you need to be carrying an Ambusheadgear and some Greedoburg before he'll appear.

515.descriptionId: You'll need to find a way to wheedle the Fogornleg Horn out of Elturt's hands. The residents of Moon Island should be able to help.

516.descriptionId: Elturt has rubbed shoulders with the Lenalds in the past. The Lenalds, who live at the south of Cawwot Island, might still remember him.

519.descriptionId: You must catch the wounded spy heading towards Brakmar and take the documents back. However, you've found a letter in your inventory.

520.descriptionId: A Bontarian spy is escaping from Brakmar by the eastern road. You must find and escort him. Hurry, every second counts!

521.descriptionId: You've found the spy in time, but the Brakmarians aren't keen on you taking those documents. Get them to Amayiro at all costs.

523.descriptionId: You must go and pick up the turtle bandana guarded by the Wobots in the Wa Wabbit Dungeon.

524.descriptionId: Convince Elturt to exchange the Fogornleg Horn for the Patched Bandana. You'll need an Ambusheadgear and a bottle of Greedoburg to make him appear.

525.descriptionId: You've been attacked by a Brakmarian who was already there, but who didn't have the Fogornleg Horn. If Ecaflip is on your side, you should be able to find the Fogornleg Horn before the Brakmarians.

526.descriptionId: Amayiro has asked you to question Magus Ax to get a better understanding of how to invoke the Fogornleg Horn's powers.

527.descriptionId: According to Oto, the innkeeper in Sufokia has information about a powerful magic horn.

528.descriptionId: The Keeper of the Ripate Inn asked you to bring him some turtle carapaces from Moon Island - one of each colour. But you could maybe do something a little easier and quicker.

529.descriptionId: The so-called guardian of the Fogornleg Horn lives in the deep jungle of Moon Island. According to popular rumour, you need to wear an Ambusheadgear and have some Greedoburg to make him appear.

530.descriptionId: Since asking nicely is not working, you'll have to act a little differently if you want to get this information.

531.descriptionId: You need to find out more about Elturt. An animal specialist should be able to help you. Oshimo, the owner of the Kennel, would be a good person to start with.

532.descriptionId: You need to create a back-scratcher that Elturt can use. Mulic Bere should be able to help you create this unique item, as he's the best Smith in Brakmar.

533.descriptionId: You must quickly find the wounded spy on the road to Bonta and take the documents. The spy must now be closer to Bonta than Brakmar.

534.descriptionId: You found the spy on time. But are you going to follow the orders, take the documents and leave him here?

535.descriptionId: Traces of a recent fight, two weapons on the ground, a dead Sram... Everything seems to point to the fact that you didn't make it in time.

536.descriptionId: A Bontarian spy infiltrated the Tower and stole the documents. Use a Zaap and intercept him. He should be on the east road leading to Bonta, but still close to Brakmar.

537.descriptionId: You must find the recipes for the ingredients listed on the paper Oto gave you.

538.descriptionId: You need to combine the necessary ingredients in the primordial cauldron: an item of each type, and an alchemist, a baker, a farmer, a butcher and a fishmonger.

539.descriptionId: You need to find out where the Fogornleg Horn is hidden - exchange a Spentox Back Scratcher for information about its location with Elturt - but what's waiting for you in Moon Island's deep jungle?

540.descriptionId: Elturt told you that the magic horn was buried in the north-east part of the island, next to a statue.

541.descriptionId: Your search was interrupted by the arrival of a Sadida. Show them what happens to those who oppose Brakmar.

542.descriptionId: You can finish your search now and report back to Oto Mustam.

544.descriptionId: Oto fears an attack from Bonta and asked you to equip some of the Brakmarian warriors with specific equipment.

572.descriptionId: Amayiro needs trustworthy people to participate in the performance presenting the fake powers of the Fogornleg Horn.

573.descriptionId: To complete the performance, Amayiro needs some Miteters, you'll find them on Cracklers. He also needs Royal Jelly Blubber (it doesn't matter what kind of Royal Jelly it comes from).

679.descriptionId: Defeat Tarche the militiaman in the room right next to this one.

680.descriptionId: Pay Lady Marmalade a visit and ask her what's going on.

681.descriptionId: You must take 20 Wholewheat Bread to Amayiro.

682.descriptionId: You must take out Gobball Teeth - as many as you'd need to make human dentures, and then take them to Ned, south-west of the city.

683.descriptionId: You must defeat Torche and take evidence of your victory to Amayiro.

684.descriptionId: You must get back Amayiro's map and a beer at the Feubuk Inn.

685.descriptionId: You must find the Crow who stole the necklace of the Mayor's daughter, defeat him and take the necklace. The crow is said to be close to the tower.

686.descriptionId: You must Inn crawl in Bonta to find the militiamen who are not working and ask for their badges.

687.descriptionId: You must find an interesting rift in the mechanisms of the gate to Brakmar.

688.descriptionId: You must find the Aggressive Boar south of Bonta and defeat him.

689.descriptionId: Amayiro asked you to take him 20 Twiggy Staff to train his troops.

690.descriptionId: The Kikim Innkeeper owes Amayiro a lot of money. You must convince him - by all means necessary - to settle his debt.

691.descriptionId: You must ask Kosuke the bladesmith to repair Amayiro's blade in exchange for a cheque.

692.descriptionId: You must find Bishom Pot in Brakmar and extract the information Amayiro asked for from him.

693.descriptionId: You must take 10 units of gunpowder to Amayiro. You can buy them from Moob Tsinhcetoryp in Bonta.

694.descriptionId: Shere Hacanon, at the entrance of Bonta, needs 4 Plain Crackler's rock blocks to close the gap in the walls.

695.descriptionId: You must carry 4 boxes from Amayiro's to the south outpost of Bonta.

696.descriptionId: You must take 15 Elite Chafer Helmets to Amayiro.

697.descriptionId: You must go and ask Ture Inge, in the militia, for a form, and then question the chief of the Trool Fair to see whether he is Brakmarian or not.

698.descriptionId: Take some Blop Flower pulp to Amayiro. To make pulp all you have to do is crush four different Blop Flowers in a Munster Crusher.

699.descriptionId: You must find a way to communicate with the passed away captain Tsog in order to get the information he wants to pass on. Captain Alrok knows where Tsog's grave is.

700.descriptionId: Amayiro asked you to bring him 20 Agility Rings

701.descriptionId: Amayiro asked you to find Zeurg (master of the Osamodas class) and talk to him about an unknown summon employed by Brakmar.

702.descriptionId: Amayiro asked you to take 10 Bontarian Cloaks to Captain Koda, next door. They are made of blue magic dye, a Crow Feather and White Gobbly Wool.

703.descriptionId: You must peel 200 pods of potatoes and take them to the militia cook.

704.descriptionId: You must save the Colonel Lyeno. He disappeared in the eastern part of the Treechnid Forest.

705.descriptionId: Danathor asked you to meet him at 9 pm with all the ingredients mentioned on his list.

708.descriptionId: The cook of the Bontarian militia, Kooc Fehc, needs 10 Tofu Legs.

709.descriptionId: Amayiro asked you to bring him a Standard Champo. You can find them on Fungi Masters.

710.descriptionId: Find the murderer of Rimaraf and take the filled-in form to Amayiro.

711.descriptionId: Find a way to fool Amayiro by showing him fake evidence. Danathor may be able to help you.

712.descriptionId: In the prison of Bonta, Captain Essacarf needs 30 pods of Scurvion Venom.

713.descriptionId: You must find Dike Tarak in the northern neighborhood, challenge him and lose.

714.descriptionId: You must find Dike Tarak in the northern neighborhood, challenge him and win.

715.descriptionId: Strange things have been going on in the baking' district. Amayiro asked you to investigate.

716.descriptionId: Amayiro asked you to explore the Cemetery of the Tortured, east of Brakmar, and see if there's a flaw in their defensive techniques. You will certainly need specific material.

717.descriptionId: Take 20 Ash Planks or 10 Treechnid Roots to Amayiro.

718.descriptionId: Danathor wrote to you and asked for your help.

719.descriptionId: Larry Poller asked for your help. You can find him close to the Tower of Bonta.

720.descriptionId: In Bonta, Grace Malcean is having troubles with her Tabi.

721.descriptionId: Amayiro has asked you to defeat Brakmarian warriors and collect ten of their badges.

722.descriptionId: The cook of the militia needs your favors again.

723.descriptionId: A certain William Lenglad is disturbing the inhabitants of Bonta. You have to calm him down, by force.

724.descriptionId: Amayiro asked you to free Atall Tramston from the prison of Brakmar, and take him back to the Bontarian militia.

725.descriptionId: Amayiro asked you to kill 4 Hyoactive Rats in the sewers of Bonta.

726.descriptionId: Defeat Mak Gahan and take one of his bones to Oto Mustam.

727.descriptionId: Oto Mustam wants to know who murdered the owner of the Burnt Cat Inn.

728.descriptionId: Oto Mustam needs three Pahoa Raid Potions.

729.descriptionId: You must take out Gobball Teeth - as many as you'd need to make human-like dentures.

730.descriptionId: The Chafer Mak Gahan wants to take his revenge.

731.descriptionId: You have to take the boxes of weapons found at the Tower of Brakmar and deliver them to Oto.

732.descriptionId: You must find a squirrel in Brakmar that stole a very important key. Take the key back to Oto.

733.descriptionId: Check the activities of the Brakmarian guards and make a report on those who do not take a break.

734.descriptionId: Oto asks for Kikim Inn Beer. The thing is... it's in Bonta!

735.descriptionId: Oto needs 10 Twiggy Hammers to train his troops.

736.descriptionId: Oto wants you to pass his message on to Vil Smisse, in the Rogues' Den - which is in the cemetery of Amakna.

737.descriptionId: Oto Mustam needs 20 pods of Scurvion venom.

738.descriptionId: Oto asked you to find the spy Finche Aticus, in Bonta, and to get his report.

739.descriptionId: You must find the warrior Tink Berval and ask him to go and take over the warrior Brank Thoof.

740.descriptionId: Oto wants 10 Chafer Helmets, well those you can find in the Cemetery of the Tortured.

741.descriptionId: Oto asked you to rid Brakmar off a lurking wolf.

742.descriptionId: You must take some Blop Pulp to Oto. He can give you the recipe.

743.descriptionId: You must find someone in Brakmar who knows how to make magic poison.

744.descriptionId: Oto asks for 5 Brakmarian Cloaks. He can tell you how to make them.

745.descriptionId: You must find Oto's will in his father's grave - which you can recognise in the cemetery thanks to the flowers around it. You must be a spirit to enter this cemetery.

746.descriptionId: Oto is broke. What can you do to help?

747.descriptionId: You must go and collect Oto's new tax in each Brakmarian Inn. And you have a free hand to make Innkeepers pay.

748.descriptionId: Oto has asked you to steal the Lung of the Plains from Azra Lazarus, the jeweller. She's said to have a guard but perhaps there's a way to avoid fighting him.

749.descriptionId: You must peel potatoes for dinner. The kitchen is downstairs in the militia.

750.descriptionId: Oto asked you to take 10 Tiwabbits Ears to Sbab to scare her. But maybe there's a way to avoid doing it if you don't want to.

751.descriptionId: Find Raaga in the mines up north and ask for his report.

752.descriptionId: A spy managed to escape Brakmar with confidential documents. One of the guards up north might have seen him.

753.descriptionId: The spy didn't have the confidential documents with him. The Sidimote fauna probably laid their hands on them.

754.descriptionId: You're supposed to lose the challenge that you launched against Puja Mustam, Oto's son. Are you really gonna let him kill you? That brat?

755.descriptionId: Oto wants 10 Treechnid Barks as firewood.

756.descriptionId: You must buy and equip the equipment Oto asked you to get before visiting him again.

757.descriptionId: You must repel the Bontarian attack on the east ramparts.

758.descriptionId: You must find a Bontarian assassin. To complete this quest, you'll need to get a Sniffling Staff from Fryda, and then use it on any Bontarian you come across until you find the right one.

759.descriptionId: Oto asked you to bring him 40 Blue Larva eyes.

760.nameId: Get Rid of the Golden Larva
760.descriptionId: You must find a way to get rid of this sticky Golden Larva which is always following you.

761.descriptionId: Take some golden dentures to Mak. You'll find them on Elite Chafers, but the blacksmith in Brakmar can also provide you with some.

762.descriptionId: You must defeat Bontarian militiamen and... collect their underpants. Oto needs 5 of them.

763.descriptionId: A Brakmarian celebrity asked after you. Go and meet her in the basement of the tower of Brakmar.

764.descriptionId: You must take some Greedovore Wine to Oto. But where can you find such a thing?

765.descriptionId: Oto asked you to kill ten turtles from Moon Island. Pop their eyes out and keep them as proof.

766.descriptionId: You must go to the east part of the rampart and defeat Bontarians.

767.descriptionId: You must free a warrior that was made prisoner by Bonta. He is in the basement of the Bontarian militia prison.

782.descriptionId: Kaffra got wind of Bonta's plans to increase their cereal production. He needs 20 Scurvion seeds to make this production Brakmar's.

783.descriptionId: Shush entrusted you with 20 modified Scurvion Seeds to leave in the Alchemists' Workshop in Bonta. You must accomplish your mission at night when Merlinmagus Ambrosius is asleep.

784.nameId: Impossible Is Nothing to a Willing Heart
784.descriptionId: Find a member of the Terra family and take them to Justfa Lafs. Setag, master of the Enutrof class, may be able to help you.

785.descriptionId: Elviana Tirips wants to know what information the Bontarian renegades gave to the Brakmarians. You're in charge of the questioning.

786.nameId: The Hunt for the Renegades Is On
786.descriptionId: Some Bontarian renegades have taken refuge in Brakmar. Find them and kill them before taking their corpses back to Bonta.

787.descriptionId: Erazal's Malediction taught you how to force a soul to resurrect against its will. To do so, you must create a specific potion and follow a very precise ritual.

792.nameId: In Search of the Blue Clerk
792.descriptionId: Tabach, Clerk of the Order of the Valiant Heart, has been searching the taverns since his cat disappeared. Take him back to Justfa Lafs.

793.descriptionId: Ybaul, Clerk of the Order of the Salvatory Spirit, has been searching the taverns since his brothers disappeared. Take him back to Elviana Tirips.

794.nameId: In Search of the Forlorn Clerk
794.descriptionId: Aigurraf, Clerk of the Order of the Sharp Eye, has been searching the taverns since his mouse disappeared. Take him back to Ebru Of El.

795.descriptionId: Kaffra Keeper asked you to bring him 1 Chafer Bone to prove your worth.

796.descriptionId: Divad Dleifrepok asked you to bring him 1 Bwork Magus Beard Hair to prove your worth.

797.descriptionId: Shush Tercesasti asked you to bring him 1 Crow Eye to prove your worth.

847.descriptionId: You have the list of creatures, now go and find them!

882.descriptionId: Go and learn how to capture souls. The Dungeon Key must be on creatures of the region.

883.descriptionId: Snori Nairb has promised to share his kamas and his experience with you if you re-enlist in the Brakmarian militia.

884.descriptionId: Snori Nairb has promised to share his kamas and his experience with you if you re-enlist in the Bontarian militia.

889.descriptionId: Find out the identity of this famous X. The letter refers to a place he used to go often. If you find this place, you'll surely get more information.

890.descriptionId: The path is now free, although the goblins were quite harmless too. Exoram is finally going to be able to tell you what he knows which should make Oto Mustam happy.

891.nameId: A Mission That's Far from Over
891.descriptionId: Traces of a fight and remains of Karnes indicate that Exoram was captured - and that he put up a good fight! Oto Mustam will not be happy when he finds out.

892.descriptionId: Exoram has got himself into real trouble again. If you're looking for information on Xephires, you'll have to help him again.

893.descriptionId: Sabine is well-guarded, so you'll have to find a way to contact Captain Starky in order to get a Kain Dharyn Crystal as ransom.

894.descriptionId: The message was sent to Captain Starky. See if Sabine kept calm while you wait for a reply.

895.descriptionId: The Bontarians tried to save Sabine. You can't let them get away with that! Go show them who's boss.

896.descriptionId: You have to take the secret passage to the Alchemists' Workshop with masters of the profession. You'll also need a Gust Potion, a Harmony and a Kobalite.

897.descriptionId: Ransacking Pandalida's house should give her the willies. You'll need 3 Tra Khben Pastes, which is made by mixing and kneading 15 Boar Snouts, 5 Pots of Greedovore and 1 Quetsnakiatl Feather.

898.descriptionId: Pandalida escaped while we were fighting, she must have gone to hide in her house. You HAVE to convince her to deliver the letter to Xephires.

899.descriptionId: Oto Mustam was convinced that you were planning on tricking him. You have to find that jewel really soon to ensure that the rest of your life is worth living.

900.descriptionId: The bandits' hideout is boobytrapped. You'll need to find someone to go with you and help you deactivate the devices protecting the bandit's treasure.

901.descriptionId: You need to get some Corruptah Stones. Miners are the only ones who can make them using the unworked creations of wild alchemists.

902.descriptionId: You have to find out where the Well of the Corrupted Souls is located so as to reveal the full power of the Corruptah Stones. Divad Dleifrepok, master of the Order of the Unsound Mind, can help you.

903.nameId: Seven Souls Or None At All
903.descriptionId: You must capture the souls of seven bandits and take them to the Well of the Corrupted Souls. You'll need some Brakmarians who are so vile that they're ready to specialise.

904.descriptionId: Oto Mustam is happy with the smith who's supplying the Bontarian militia and wants you to make sure things continue this way.

905.descriptionId: Latem Sa just got the ore and new tools. You should act quickly while he's gone. He'll be away between five and nine o' clock in the evening, so you can sneak in, steal the ore and switch the tools.

906.descriptionId: Find another hideout for the spies that lies between their current location and the library. Neutralise the occupants of the new place if necessary.

907.nameId: Taming the Beast, and the Animal Too
907.descriptionId: Oto Mustam wants to find out the secret to taming Whitish Fangs. Go back to the Bonta Library to find some clues.

908.nameId: Taming the Beast, and the Animal Too
908.descriptionId: Oto Mustam wants to find out the secret to taming Whitish Fangs. Go back to the Bonta Library to find some clues.

909.nameId: Taming the Beast, and the Animal Too
909.descriptionId: Oto Mustam wants to find out the secret to taming Whitish Fangs. Go back to the Bonta Library to find some clues.

910.nameId: If You Want Something Done Properly
910.descriptionId: The information that the Ripate Inn Innkeeper revealed to you is not useful as things stand. A little chat with someone more learned could prove more fruitful.

911.descriptionId: You've a rough idea what Oto Mustam might have planned for your next mission, and as such, it might be better to pave the way by picking up a few Kokokonuts.

912.descriptionId: What with Elturt being hungry, and your strong-arm tactics not working, you need to find a way of poisoning him instead. Someone living on the island must know what a turtle's favourite food is.

913.descriptionId: According to Oshimo, Elturt has an archnemesis. Apparently, Herr Palp Itane signed a contract with some demons to increase his powers. He lives on Gwavestone Island.

914.nameId: Spentox, It Itches and It Scratches
914.descriptionId: Mulic Bere has let you use his special forge to create a Spentox Back-Scratcher.

915.descriptionId: Get into the bandits' hideout using a rope. And don't go alone!

916.descriptionId: You have to find the key to the hideout, which obviously means you have to get your hands on the bandit who has the key. Hersa's ex-lover could be the one.

917.descriptionId: Make copies of the key to the bandits' hideout, then go in there in a group and take any documents that could relate to the investigation.

918.descriptionId: You brought Exoram to the Sram temple. This time you'd be better off telling them what you promised you would.

919.nameId: Flip That Eca Like a Pancake
919.descriptionId: Now you can make the keys and inspect the bandits' hideout for clues. You'll need a climbing rope to get down there.

920.descriptionId: Someone has written a report criticising you heavily. It's in the Bonta Tower of Orders. You should get your hands on it as soon as possible in order to prove your innocence.

921.descriptionId: Find an accomplice to distract the guards while you steal the documents.

922.descriptionId: You'll need the help of a Sram or a qualified spy to help you get into Brakmar's poison reserves.

923.descriptionId: You have to steal the client register from the Alchemists' Workshop in Brakmar and take it to Rigal Hookhand.

924.descriptionId: Xarthan is going to the Tower of Bonta to meet a Brakmarian after his meeting with some important people. You should hurry so as not to miss him.

925.descriptionId: You should find some militians to post at the Tower of Bonta.

926.descriptionId: There's a Sram who owes Oto Mustam some money. She hasn't paid him back, so Oto has decided to eliminate her. She's probably in the illegal gambling room.

927.descriptionId: Kosuke Ichazum was right - Latem Sa got the contract to equip the Bontarian Militia through cronyism and not for his skills as a smith.

928.descriptionId: Nara gave you a long list of materials he needs to make the equipment for the Bontarian militia. You have to take them to him in the Porcos' Mine.

929.descriptionId: You must find a tactician and convince him to join Bonta's ranks.

930.descriptionId: Either Pol Dullbow doesn't know any more, or he doesn't want to say any more. Whatever the case, the Bwork Magi should be a little less reluctant to sell out one of their own.

931.descriptionId: If you remove the curse on Jibworknouille, he'll definitely tell you everything he knows to thank you. He also suggested you go to a library to find out more.

932.descriptionId: You have to find four Sadidas who are experienced enough to invoke Inflatables for a ritual involving the enchanted waters of the Koalak lakes.

933.descriptionId: Touh Flowa showed you where the entrance to the vegetal prison was. He seemed to have his head in the clouds. You better pray he didn't leave anything out!

934.descriptionId: According to the keeper of the Ripate Inn, the horn can be found on an island. The scholars should be able to tell you more.

935.descriptionId: It would be a kind gesture to stock up on Kokokonuts before heading back to see Amayiro, don't you think?

936.descriptionId: Amayiro wishes to know more about Elturt. Oshimo, the guardian of the Kennel, will surely have more information about the turtle.

937.descriptionId: You must find a way of bringing the bandana back to its former glory. A tailor should be able to help.

938.descriptionId: Beneath the Alchemists' Market is a cupboard. You need to stand in front of it to open the secret passage. Magus Ax is waiting for you there.

939.descriptionId: It's time to head back to Bonta and assess the situation with Amayiro.

945.descriptionId: Snori Nairb got you into the Brakmarian Militia, but he did it unofficially. To make things official, you'll need to talk to Oto Mustam.

946.descriptionId: Snori Nairb got you into the Bontarian Militia, but he did it unofficially. To make things official, you'll need to talk to Amayiro.

952.descriptionId: The Brakmarians must take the documents to their superiors. You've written up some false documents to replace them and send your enemies off on a wild goose chase.

953.descriptionId: Take Sabine to Oto Mustam by force. You'll have to make sure she doesn't get an opportunity to escape.

955.descriptionId: You have visited all the locations as Setag asked. Now you just have to convince Nara to move to one of them.

956.descriptionId: The current plan of attack has not been confirmed. Find out about any confirmation or change to the plan from Kapp Tenn and report back to Amayiro.

963.descriptionId: Oto Mustam wants to sabotage Bonta's equipment, so he's planning to replace the forgers' tools with 5 Hurrian Hammers.

979.descriptionId: If you defeat the Dopple, the master of combat will reward you.

982.descriptionId: If you defeat the Dopple, the master of combat will reward you.

992.descriptionId: If you defeat the Dopple, the master of combat will reward you.

995.descriptionId: Confront the Dopple in each of the class temples.

1021.descriptionId: You've chosen to use the most extreme solution. Well, the most Brakmarian one, shall we say.

1034.descriptionId: Warko Linch is preparing a brew which will free the Koalaks from the hold of the Sadidettes in Skeunk's service.

1035.descriptionId: The Puddlies have hidden their secret in the base of the statue. Get down on your hands and knees and look for it.

1041.descriptionId: In exchange for his secret route to the Pet Sanctuary, Oshimo requires a Bow Meow.

1042.descriptionId:
Hi, I'm Joris and I'm going to help you take your first steps into this world!

Let's start by pressing on the ground to move your character around.

1044.descriptionId: Open the {ui,banner,btn_items,1::inventory}. Move the {ui,storage,grid::Novice Ring} to the {ui,storage,slot_2,2::ring slot} or double-tap it.

1045.descriptionId: To change maps, touch one of the {transition,35651584,0,520,0,0::screen's edges}, and an arrow will appear.

1046.descriptionId: Press on the {monster,2785::Incarnam Scarecrow} and choose "Attack" to start a fight.

1047.descriptionId: Tap a {cell,272::red cell} to choose your starting position and then tap the {ui,banner,btn_ready::Ready button} to start the fight.

1048.descriptionId:
Moving 1 cell costs 1 {ui,banner,lbl_pm,2::movement point} (MP).
Move your character by sliding your finger on the screen.
You'll recover your {ui,banner,lbl_pm,2::MP} at the start of the following turn.

1049.descriptionId:
Choose {ui,banner,gd_spellitemotes,0::a spell}, slide your finger to the target, and release.
The spell's range is shown by the blue cells. Spells need {ui,banner,lbl_pa,2::action points} (AP) to be cast.
You'll recover those at the start of the next turn.

1050.descriptionId: When you've finished your turn, press the {ui,banner,btn_skipTurn::End of Turn} button to speed up the fight and regain your {ui,banner,lbl_pa,2::AP} and your {ui,banner,lbl_pm,2::MP}.

1051.descriptionId:
Keep attacking your target by casting {ui,banner,gd_spellitemotes,0::spells} to win the fight.
You can cast several spells per turn depending on their cost in {ui,banner,lbl_pa,2::AP}.

1052.descriptionId: Talk to {npc,1222::Master Apro Simate} to start a quest. NPCs who have a quest for you to carry out will have an exclamation mark above their heads.

1053.descriptionId: To continue your quest, move to the {transition,35652610,2,700,1,0::next map} and start a fight with {monster,2781::the monster}.

1055.descriptionId: A battle that will put all your new skills to the test.

1056.descriptionId: You've just arrived, and you've already been offered an effortless way to make your life easier. What more could you want?

1057.descriptionId: You should have followed Het Dawa's advice and taken care. Now it seems your life is on the line. Alas, life is not as simple as one would think.

1058.descriptionId: With your help, Het Dawa should be able to eradicate the illness that has affected the Pandawan beverage market, provided an antidote can be found.

1059.descriptionId: Talk to {npc,1222::Master Apro Simate} to complete your quest. NPCs who can validate quest objectives have a question mark above their heads.

1060.descriptionId: Open the {ui,banner,btn_items,1::inventory} and equip items. Wearing multiple items in a single set will give your character additional bonuses.

1061.descriptionId: Win the fight. Turns now have a limited duration, so be careful. The {ui,banner,tx_timeFrame,4::remaining time gauge} shows how much time you have left before your turn ends.

1062.descriptionId: You must defeat the Manitou Zoth and take proof of your victory to Bob the Enutrof.

1063.descriptionId: Some dreadful creatures have burgled Father Kwismas's warehouse. You need to get back the boxes of gifts that they've stolen - with or without their consent - and return them to Harry Kwismas.

1064.descriptionId: Some dreadful creatures have burgled Father Kwismas's warehouse. You need to get back the boxes of gifts that they've stolen - with or without their consent - and return them to Harry Kwismas.
