1091.descriptionId: Some dreadful creatures have burgled Father Kwismas's warehouse. You need to get back the boxes of gifts that they've stolen - with or without their consent - and return them to Harry Kwismas.

1093.descriptionId: The legend of Goultard does not recount his whole life. Follow his story from childhood to discover its secrets.

1096.descriptionId: Place some small, white pebbles in Dark Vlad's Labyrinth.

1097.descriptionId: All the pieces have been placed. Now for the final blow.

1102.descriptionId: Dragonsly has shown you where to find the chief instructor to start your alchemist training.

1103.descriptionId: Go and see the Alchemist Examiner, who is currently doing research on the calcium levels of post-mortem intranasal cartilage.

1107.descriptionId: Clyde Parker has asked you to get rid of the Mastogobs in the Ice Fields.

1108.descriptionId: Clyde Parker has asked you to get rid of the forest creatures on the Lonesome Pine Trails.

1109.descriptionId: Clyde Parker has asked you to get rid of the Pingwins on the Frozen Lake.

1110.descriptionId: Clyde Parker has asked you to get rid of the Pirate Ghosts in Alma's Cradle.

1111.descriptionId: Clyde Parker has asked you to get rid of the Steam Cracklers in the Tears of Ouronigride.

1112.descriptionId: Clyde Parker has asked you to get rid of the lava creatures in the Obsidemon's Hypogeum.

1113.descriptionId: As usual, Bea Fortax is sleeping instead of supplying Frigostine. The baker has asked you to take the place of her employee.

1114.descriptionId: Unable to leave his shop unattended, Jon Burrowman has asked you to be his supplier.

1115.descriptionId: With the influx of adventurers, the Icefish reserves are rapidly depleting, so Clarisse Tocate has asked you to bring more supplies.

1116.descriptionId: With the influx of adventurers, the meat reserves are rapidly depleting, and so Al Shab has asked you to restock them.

1117.descriptionId: With mining virtually at a standstill for several decades, the Obsidian reserves used for casting alloys have run dry. Laurent Gebleuh has asked you to help replenish his stock.

1118.descriptionId: Chief Anbifketf needs massive amounts of wood to fuel the port's defrosting system. He has asked you to lend a hand.

1119.descriptionId: You've found a Vibrating Pingwin Feather, but you have no idea what purpose it serves. Fortunately, you heard some fishermen talking, and they were quoting Delphie Fillea. Maybe she can tell you more.

1120.descriptionId: Exterminate the threat in Grandfather's cellar.

1121.descriptionId: Speak to Grandfather again and show him the remains of the Stunted Rat.

1123.descriptionId: Truffo has asked you to calm the ardours of the Royal Mastogob, who has become aggressive as a result of the tropical heat in the greenhouse and the lack of food.

1124.descriptionId: Mousse Haka has told you where to find the mayor, who should be able provide information on Frigost Village and its inhabitants.

1125.descriptionId: To familiarise yourself with Frigost Village, Mayor Cantile has asked you to meet with several Frigostians.

1126.descriptionId: Captain Ardier has offered you a magnificent cruise on his authentic ship to visit the remote Island of Frigost.

1127.descriptionId: To create cereal species that are more resistant to cold, Cassiopeia Sant has asked you to bring her several types of seeds.

1128.descriptionId: Cassiopeia Sant wants to diversify the production from growing cereals and needs new varieties of seeds that can be found on The Lonesome Pine Trails.

1129.descriptionId: The Pingwins' strength seems to come from a diet rich in iron. Cassiopeia Sant has asked you to kill some to get their seed reserve.

1130.descriptionId: The lack of salt has provoked an outbreak of Astrubism amongst the Frigostians. To stem this scourge, Cassiopeia Sant wants to try to cultivate Grains of Salt in a suitable greenhouse.

1131.descriptionId: Cassiopeia Sant wants to cross Frosteez with Grenhayde Seeds and Hay Seeds for natural resistance against pests and weeds.

1132.descriptionId: Cassiopeia Sant wants Basalt Seeds to improve the resistance of Frosteez to sudden changes in temperature, and Cole Seeds to cross with Grains of Salt.

1133.descriptionId: Circey Real wants to experiment with new cereal hybrids and requires your help.

1134.descriptionId: Circey Real has persuaded the mayor to let you go into the Petrified Forest to get the magic seeds.

1135.nameId: Even Heroes Have to Grasp the Nettle Sometimes
1135.descriptionId: Circey Real is unhappy with previous results, and so would like you to collect seeds from the Fangs of Glass.

1136.descriptionId: Circey Real wants to further her agricultural research using the cereals of the Bearbarians from Mount Scauldron.

1137.descriptionId: You must take blood samples from sick Mastogobs to Herr Peece.

1138.descriptionId: Herr Peece needs Isotonic Seawater. Only Cap'n Tankerous knows how to get it.

1139.descriptionId: You must collect a blood sample from Herr Peece's guinea pig.

1140.descriptionId: You have to find something to stop ticks from infesting the Mastogobs.

1141.descriptionId: Wogew the Hewmit thinks Otomai can help him with his research and so has asked you to bring him some documents.

1142.descriptionId: Valy Domidat, the chief handywoman, has disappeared on her way to repair the pipes by the Farmers' Workshop. Francky, her employee, has asked you to find her.

1143.nameId: Igloo Knew Jean-Pierre Like I Know Jean-Pierre
1143.descriptionId: Jean-Pierre Kofkof was involved in the dispute between Valy Domidat and a stranger. He may have noticed something unusual.

1144.descriptionId: Several Frigostians employed by Chief Anbifketf have disappeared in the Lonesome Pine Trails. You must find out what happened to them.

1145.nameId: Fantastic Fourest: Return to the City
1145.descriptionId: You found the survivors, victims of a strange curse. You must escort them into town, one by one.

1146.descriptionId: Gerard the hunter has disappeared. Clyde Parker, the militia leader, has asked you to find him.

1147.descriptionId: Chief Anbifketf needs huge quantities of wood for the steam guns' heating system.

1148.descriptionId: Chief Anbifketf needs huge quantities of wood for the steam guns' heating system.

1149.descriptionId: Damar, chief fisherman of the Frozen Lake, needs materials to repair the fishing equipment.

1150.descriptionId: Damar needs the help of Valy Domidat, Frigost's handywoman.

1151.descriptionId: Pingwins are attacking the fishermen. You must help Mel repel them.

1152.descriptionId: A new wave of Pingwins is attacking the fishermen. You must help Mel repel them.

1153.descriptionId: A new wave of Pingwins is attacking the fishermen. You must help Mel repel them.

1154.descriptionId: Damar wants to take advantage of the demoralised Pingwins and reopen the snapper supply lines.

1155.descriptionId: To renovate the old village of Frigost, Aurora Borealis has opted for a mixture of Aspen Wood and planks made from Kaliptus Wood. You must provide her with them.

1156.nameId: An Inoffensive Dopple, and Inoffensive Class
1156.descriptionId: That Old Stuffed Feca Dopple must belong to someone, but who?

1157.nameId: His Name Is MacGayver - He Can Fix Anything
1157.descriptionId: Chewing gum is an indispensable tool for Mac Gayver, the Xelor. He will be delighted to receive it.

1158.descriptionId: Bisale Vinlenta needs large quantities of flowers for his alternative to agriculture.

1159.descriptionId: Bisale Vinlenta is looking for pre-glacial plants to breed from.

1160.descriptionId: To improve the taste of his plants, Bisale Vinlenta wants to use Ershop Rhubarb, that only Pingwins have.

1161.descriptionId: Clarice Peseay is offering orphan Pingwinkles in exchange for Icefish.

1162.descriptionId: Aurora Borealis plans to open a hotel cut completely out of the ice, and needs plenty of tools to do so.

1163.descriptionId: The owner of the family chest will surely reward anyone who returns it.

1164.descriptionId: You can give the sealed book to Hugo Frost the archivist or Hippolyte Thermia the librarian.

1165.descriptionId: Waldos FieldChester Potcobble wants to cook a Royal Icefish for a candlelit dinner with Aurora Borealis. He has asked you to fetch one for him.

1166.descriptionId: Mac Gayver needs skilled labourers, and you must convince the Mayor of Frigost to let him canvass people from Frigost Village.

1167.descriptionId: Fearing the spread of the Lurgi, Mac Gayver needs several vaccines.

1168.descriptionId: Fred Handed wants to know where his late father has hidden his loot.

1169.nameId: He Dreamed of a Long Trip on a Boat
1169.descriptionId: Kack Handed has agreed to reveal the location of his loot if you manage to free his soul.

1170.descriptionId: Some people say they saw him heading towards the Asparah Gorge after one of his crimes, to the north of the island. He needs locking up in Frigost Village for his carnivorous carry-ons with the breeding Mastogobs.

1171.descriptionId: Some people claim they were attacked near the hot springs in the Tears of Ouronigride. The Masked Avenger is sought for disturbing public order and unjustified revenge.

1172.descriptionId: Some claim to have seen her in the company of ghosts. She is wanted for stealing a silver mask and for repeated attacks on domestic ferrets.

1173.descriptionId: Some claim to have seen Mister Penguin surrounded by Pingwins. He is wanted for Icefish theft and GBH on fishermen.

1174.descriptionId: Herr Peece fears an outbreak of the Lurgi and has asked you to immunise the sick.

1175.nameId: Mama, I Just Killed a Pingwin...
1175.descriptionId: Fearing their extinction, Ken Tucky wants to round up some Mama Pingwins to preserve the species.

1176.descriptionId: To fight against deforestation, Getafiks has asked you to plant some seeds.

1177.descriptionId: You must escort an injured hunter to Frigost Village, so that he can be tended by the physician Herr Peece.

1178.descriptionId: You must escort an injured hunter to Frigost Village, so that he can be tended by the physician Herr Peece.

1179.descriptionId: You must escort an injured hunter to Frigost Village, so that he can be tended by the physician Herr Peece.

1180.descriptionId: While Djauns watches over his treasure, you need to get a team of Snow Bow Wows together and take it to him. The clock is ticking.

1181.descriptionId: The Frigostians have mounted a punitive expedition to get rid of the YeCh'Ti. They need Intact Snowfoux Furs to deceive it.

1182.descriptionId: Little Nick and his friends are holding a competition and you are the judging panel. You must choose which of their snowmonsters is the most horrible.

1183.descriptionId: Tutthe Larry needs a new assistant and has put you in charge of recruitment.

1184.descriptionId: Larry Tutthe is overwhelmed and needs a helping hand.

1185.nameId: Ogivol Victor's Water Brings Us Hope
1185.descriptionId: Ogivol Victor needs your help to collect mineral water in order to analyse it and make it potable.

1186.descriptionId: An alchemist can help you better understand the identity of the creature found in the Tears of Ouronigride.

1187.descriptionId: Some crazy Snowfoux have been preying on travellers. You must defeat them.

1188.descriptionId: The Corpstive wants revenge on the farmer who killed him. He's asked you to be his weapon of vengeance.

1189.descriptionId: Gromeo and Julie can't get married because their families hate each other. They're begging you to find a solution.

1190.nameId: Out of the Mouth of Adults...
1190.descriptionId: Julie has a plan to find out what exactly happened and it's up to you to carry it out.

1191.descriptionId: The Lattecups don't appear to have anything to do with the cereal theft, but something isn't right. You just need to find out what.

1192.descriptionId: Julie has been kidnapped by a Kanigloo. Gromeo has tried to save her, but in vain. He's begged you to free her.

1193.nameId: As Thick As Four Short Planks
1193.descriptionId: Find and bring back planks of different tree species.

1194.nameId: The Philanthropy of the Master Carpenter

1195.descriptionId: Find a shoemaker to make the boots.

1197.descriptionId: To help Frigost's doctor, Bisale Vinlenta needs 70 Rosenberg Willows.

1198.descriptionId: Bisale Vinlenta needs new plants that grow only in the Tears of Ouronigride.

1199.nameId: Journey to the Centre of the Tunnel
1199.descriptionId: In anticipation of a possible warm period Bisale Vinlenta wants to cross current plant species with those in the Obsidemon's Hypogeum.

1200.descriptionId: The naturalist Plinee the Elder has gone missing in the Tears of Ouronigride. At the request of his nephew, Plinee the Younger, Hippolyte Thermia has asked you to find him.

1201.descriptionId: Count Harebourg is accused of having misled the Frigostian population and causing the Ice Age. A large reward is promised to anyone who eliminates him.

1203.descriptionId: Jon Burrowman is counting on you to gather lilies from the Asparah Gorge.

1204.descriptionId: Bea Fortax would like you to find her fianc Al Ive, who disappeared before the Ice Age, and give him her letter.

1205.descriptionId: Bea wishes to avenge Al Ive's death.

1206.descriptionId: Find the ideal person to give the Mother of Pearl Brooch to.

1207.descriptionId: Izxbo Lfopcz ibt btlfe zpv up efgfbu b Hpcmjo jo uif njoft tp uibu if dbo tufbm b ovhhfu.

1208.descriptionId: Get to know the inhabitants of Frigost Village and protect yourself from the Lurgi.

1209.descriptionId: The fishermen of the Frozen Lake need help.

1210.descriptionId: Some Frigostians have disappeared. Mayor Cantile has asked you to look for them.

1211.descriptionId: Lou Bricante has let you know that the farmers might need your help. Find out more from  Cassiopeia Sant or Bisale Vinlenta.

1212.descriptionId: Lou Bricante has invited you to prove yourself against the monsters present in the dungeons of Frigost.

1213.descriptionId: Lou Bricante has told you that there are a few ruffians going around with prices on their heads.

1214.descriptionId:
You must defeat your opponent in a single fight.
Good luck.

1215.descriptionId:
Some people claim to have received an orange Kanigloo to the head on the Lonesome Pine Trails.
Katigger is wanted for fatal bodyslamming.

1216.descriptionId: Some people claim to have seen Mastoslob in the Icefields. He is actively sought for consuming and digesting the loot of his owner without their permission.

1217.descriptionId: Find Barnaby. He has been abducted and taken somewhere beyond this World.

1218.descriptionId: Bambelle needs your help seeking advice from the Francky the handyman.

1219.nameId: Scraping the Bottom of the Barrel
1219.descriptionId: Bambelle needs a copy of the plans for the pipework near the Sawmill. The originals can be found in the possession of Hugo Frost the archivist and Valy Domidat the Handywoman.

1220.nameId: Deliver the Letter to Mac Spayne
1220.descriptionId: You must discreetly deliver the letter to Mac Spayne.

1221.nameId: Deliver the Letter to Jean-Pierre Kofkof
1221.descriptionId: You must discretely deliver the letter to Jean-Pierre Kofkof.

1222.nameId: Deliver the Letter to Bisale Vinlenta
1222.descriptionId: You must discretely deliver the letter to Bisale Vinlenta.

1223.nameId: Deliver the Letter to Cap'n Tankerous
1223.descriptionId: You must discretely deliver the letter to Cap'n Tankerous.

1224.nameId: Deliver the Letter to Quentin Flush
1224.descriptionId: You must discretely deliver the letter to Quentin Flush.

1225.nameId: Deliver the Letter to Mac Gayver
1225.descriptionId: You must discretely deliver the letter to Mac Gayver.

1226.nameId: Deliver the Letter to Larry Tutthe
1226.descriptionId: You must discretely deliver the letter to Larry Tutthe.

1227.nameId: Deliver the Letter to Fred Handed
1227.descriptionId: You must discretely deliver the letter to Fred Handed.

1228.nameId: Deliver the Letter to Clarisse Tocate
1228.descriptionId: You must discretely deliver the letter to Clarisse Tocate.

1229.nameId: Deliver the Letter to Herr Peece
1229.descriptionId: You must discretely deliver the letter to Herr Peece.

1230.nameId: Deliver the Letter to Baka Laive
1230.descriptionId: You must discretely deliver the letter to Baka Laive.

1231.nameId: Deliver the Letter to Yuan Hermetical
1231.descriptionId: You must discretely deliver the letter to Yuan Hermetical.

1232.nameId: Deliver the Letter to Onme Eadson
1232.descriptionId: You must discretely deliver the letter to Onme Eadson.

1233.nameId: Deliver the Letter to Salah Connol
1233.descriptionId: You must discretely deliver the letter to Salah Connol.

1235.descriptionId: Phantomahawk wants proof of Buck Anear's defeat.

1236.descriptionId: Lavaz Za wants to give the bodies of his comrades a decent burial.

1237.descriptionId: Herr Peece would like to send a humanitarian aid convoy to the Snowbound Village, in the north of the island.

1238.descriptionId: Baka Laive has asked you to exterminate some Snowfoux and bring him back proof.

1239.descriptionId: Baka Laive has asked you to exterminate some plants and bring him back proof.

1240.descriptionId: Baka Laive has asked you to exterminate some Brockhards and bring him back proof.

1241.descriptionId: Baka Laive has asked you to exterminate some Bearbarians and bring him back proof.

1242.descriptionId: Charlie Endstown-Smisse has offered you a holiday with the Kanniballs of Moon Island. It's an opportunity not to be missed.

1243.descriptionId: Herr Peece is waiting on the results of a blood test from a Royal Mastogob for information on a possible permanent vaccine against the Lurgi.

1244.descriptionId: Herr Peece has written a list of ingredients necessary to make a new vaccine. Bring them to him all at the same time or he won't accept them.

1245.descriptionId: Jon Burrowman would like to make your trip to the Petrified Forest worthwhile.

1246.nameId: The Fangs of Glass Bite Back
1246.descriptionId: Jon Burrowman has asked you to collect the flowers that grow in the Fangs of Glass.

1247.descriptionId: Jon Burrowman covets the flowers of Mount Scauldron which he routinely used before the big freeze.

1248.descriptionId: Herr Peece needs samples from the bodies of Frigostians trapped in the ice.

1249.descriptionId: The Snowfoux King refuses to let you cross his cavern. It's down to you to change his mind.

1250.descriptionId: Perhaps the Petrified Forest hides buried treasure. Can you find it?

1251.descriptionId: Charlie Endstown-Smisse has offered you a trip to the Haunted House at the Trool Fair. It's an opportunity not to be missed.

1252.descriptionId: You have noticed that the resonance crystal vibrates more strongly in the Fangs of Glass.

1253.descriptionId: The crystals from the Fangs of Glass are resonating together. You need to find someone able to explain what this phenomenon means.

1254.descriptionId: To show her gratitude, Oynop has decided to improve your Ellie's Mental Amulet.

1255.nameId: A Yo Ho Ho and a... Sausage?
1255.descriptionId: You'll need an Element Flask, a Climbing Rope and a friend before starting your ascent of the Cania Massif.

1256.descriptionId: Oynop needs a few last resources. Take them to her.

1257.descriptionId:
Moutou Louse and Albert Lioz had to abandon some crates in the Petrified Forest so that they could escape with their lives.
You've been tasked with recovering them.

1258.descriptionId: According to Moutou Louse, no one's interested in the strange noises coming from the Petrified Forest, as it's considered haunted. If you want to find out more, you'll have to count on yourself, and yourself alone.

1259.descriptionId: Because of her carelessness, Nicki Kerrs might be inclined to help you. You just need to convince her.

1260.nameId: It's Nice, but Hot, but Nice
1260.descriptionId: You must carry out the three missions entrusted to you by the P.A.N.T.S. Prophets successfully before you can be accepted into their ranks and obtain their help.

1261.descriptionId: Asselo should be able to help you free the lumberjacks from the ice, as long as you follow his advice.

1262.descriptionId: You have access to a secret map in the Obsidemon's Hypogeum. It would be better if you didn't go in there alone.

1263.descriptionId: You have access to a secret map in the Asparah Gorge. It would be better if you didn't go in there alone.

1264.descriptionId: You have access to a secret map in the Petrified Forest. It would be better if you didn't go in there alone.

1265.descriptionId: You have access to a secret map in the Fangs of Glass. It would be better if you didn't go in there alone.

1266.descriptionId: Lou Bricante has indicated several of the island's important areas to you.

1267.descriptionId: Tray Beard needs Korriander organs to heal the villagers. She's counting on you to defeat this monster.

1268.descriptionId: Long John the Feca has promised you an attractive reward for each 'Wanted' monster you bring to him.

1269.descriptionId: Some people claim to have heard her cries of joy towards the caverns of the Asparah Gorge. She needs to be kept away from the male Snowfoux to help stabilise the birth rate.

1270.descriptionId: Some people claim to have seen victims of its corruption in the Petrified Forest. This plant needs capturing so it can be bound and buried many metres underground.

1271.descriptionId: Some people claim to have heard, rather than seen, him after a drunken evening in the Fangs of Glass. He needs capturing and locking up as quickly as possible.

1272.descriptionId: Some people claim he never leaves the Bearbarian Hive. He needs to be captured and imprisoned without leaving a trace.

1273.descriptionId: Baka Laive wants to see some Snowfoux Dentures to prove you took part in their extermination. Take them to him once the invasion is over.

1274.descriptionId: Herr Peece, tired of being unable to save lives, needs resources for some new experiments.

1275.descriptionId: Herr Peece has asked you to deliver some letters to the alchemists of Frigost.

1276.descriptionId: You're drawing on your last reserves to reach the summit.

1277.nameId: Is There Glory at the Summit?
1277.descriptionId: The mountain is the last step of your journey. What will you find there?

1278.descriptionId: Herr Peece needs samples from the Brockhards.

1279.descriptionId: Herr Peece has written you a cheque so you can take a little time out. Let's hope that nothing untoward happens in the meantime.

1280.descriptionId: Herr Peece has designed a creature to destroy Count Harebourg, but it has escaped. You must neutralise it before it is too late.

1281.descriptionId: Find Herb Cut, who has been kidnapped by the YeCh'Ti and taken to the Asparah Gorge.

1282.descriptionId: Find a use for the Larva Egg in the Bearbarian Hive.

1283.descriptionId: Charlie Endstown-Smisse has suggested a visit to see the Kwaks in their natural habitat. It's an opportunity not to be missed.

1285.descriptionId: Baka Laive claims that Francis died somewhere in the Fangs of Glass. You have to prove it.

1286.descriptionId: You have everything you need to carry out your rescue mission.

1287.nameId: Give Her the Old Hive Ho
1287.descriptionId: Albert Lioz hasn't heard from Maya and has asked you to search for her in the Bearbarian Hive.

1288.descriptionId: Maya would like to divert some of the Bearbarians' honey to the villagers. She's counting on you to help.

1289.descriptionId: You found Maya at the summit of the Bearbarian Hive, which doesn't bode well at all.

1290.nameId: Parfait Is the French Word For
1290.descriptionId: Kyak thinks parfait to be an arguably perfect dessert. Ask the inhabitants of the village what they think.

1293.descriptionId: Reparation work on the bridge that links Pandala Island to the Amaknian mainland has been interrupted because of invasive larvae. Exterminate them.

1294.descriptionId: The bridge workers are dehydrated. They need a refreshing drink.

1295.descriptionId: Herb Cut's kidnapping was staged to look like the YeCh'Ti was responsible. Herb Cut wants you to find out the identity of the real culprits.

1296.nameId: One Ring to Find Them All
1296.descriptionId: To find out more about Quentin Flush, Bonnie Barrow suggests you listen to Clarisse Tocate's gossip.

1297.descriptionId: Jos Bovey has told you about an altercation between Herb Cut and Gormor the Mangler at the Frigostian Paradise Tavern. Herb Cut will be able to tell you more.

1298.descriptionId: Only Clarisse Tocate's neighbours will be able to confirm her rumours. If you can find any witnesses, that is.

1299.descriptionId: Ernest Laye has admitted his involvement in Herb Cut's kidnapping. You still need to find out what his accomplices' motives were.

1300.descriptionId: Herr Peece needs Mastogob Blood Samples so that he can continue making Lurgi Vaccine.

1301.descriptionId: Defeat the Royal Mastogob on his own turf and get out of the greenhouse alive.

1302.descriptionId: Defeat the Royal Pingwin on his own turf and get out of the excavation alive.

1303.descriptionId: Defeat Buck Anear on his own turf and get out of the wreck alive.

1304.descriptionId: Defeat the Obsidemon on his own turf and get out of the hypogeum alive.

1305.descriptionId: Defeat Tengu Snowfoux on his own turf and get out of the den alive.

1306.descriptionId: Defeat Korriander on his own turf and get out of the lair alive.

1307.descriptionId: Defeat Kolosso on his own turf and get out of the caverns alive.

1308.descriptionId: Defeat the Celestial Bearbarian on his own turf and get out of the antechamber alive.

1309.descriptionId: To serve your city, you must help capture Frigost's most dangerous creatures.

1310.descriptionId: Defeat the Royal Mastogob so that it may be captured.

1311.descriptionId: Defeat the Royal Pingwin so that it may be captured.

1312.descriptionId: Defeat Buck Anear so that he may be captured.

1313.descriptionId: Defeat the Obsidemon so that it may be captured.

1314.descriptionId: Defeat Tengu Snowfoux so that it may be captured.

1315.descriptionId: Defeat Korriander so that it may be captured.

1316.descriptionId: Defeat Kolosso so that it may be captured.

1317.descriptionId: Defeat the Celestial Bearbarian so that it may be captured.

1318.descriptionId: Something isn't right at the Number Anticroist Inn. You must find out what.

1319.descriptionId: Rogue Bapapa wants you to help him out with a big job. You should follow his instructions.

1320.descriptionId: Thanks to an ingenious plan, you're going to be able to steal a giant kama from Astrub bank.

1321.descriptionId: You've decided to venture into the first Kwismas Dungeon. Who knows what hijinks might ensue!

1322.nameId: Strike the Heart, Enjoy the Florist
1322.descriptionId: You've decided to venture into the second Kwismas Dungeon. Who knows what hijinks might ensue!

1323.descriptionId: You've decided to venture into the third Kwismas Dungeon. Who knows what hijinks might ensue!

1324.descriptionId: If you defeat the Dopple, the master of combat will reward you.

1325.descriptionId: To access the Charlie's Agents dungeons, you must speak to Charlie Endstown-Smisse in the Smith's Workshop in Amakna Village.

1326.descriptionId: Amayiro would like to know why the island of Frigost has made contact with the mainland after almost a century of silence.

1327.descriptionId: Oto Mustam would like to know why the island of Frigost has made contact with the mainland after almost a century of silence.

1328.descriptionId: Kwismas spirit is all about celebrations and trying to be a better person.

1329.descriptionId: Cuspular wants the heart of one of the dungeon Guardians, if not he'll take yours.

1330.descriptionId: If you defeat the Dopple, the master of combat will reward you.

1331.descriptionId: Isgrate Giftoyu has hired you to pick blop flowers.

1332.nameId: Thanks to the Fields of Flowers
1332.descriptionId: Isgrate Giftoyu has given you a new list of flowers to bring him.

1333.descriptionId: Isgrate Giftoyu wants even more flowers.

1334.descriptionId: Isgrate Giftoyu is sending you to pick rare flowers in the hope of awakening your sensitivity.

1335.descriptionId: To thank you for your help and to awaken your sensitivity, Isgrate Giftoyu has told you where to find an amulet containing the power of love.

1336.descriptionId: Babali has asked you to help him put an end to the threat which is burdening him.

1337.descriptionId: For the next part of the plan, Babali wants you to meet him at Marp's house.

1338.nameId: Out of the Frying Pan, into the Fire
1338.descriptionId: Master Yakasi has asked you to talk to  Dairdre and Lykhen. Luckily for you, they're not far away.

1339.nameId: Find Out More About the Beast
1339.descriptionId: Otomai's apprentice wants to capture the Beast, who is causing chaos in Astrub. First of all, he asked you to find out the latest news about it from certain townspeople.

1340.descriptionId: The apprentice has asked you to help prepare the trap. When everything is in place, all you'll have to do is wait for the monster to take the bait!

1341.descriptionId: The trap hasn't worked according to plan, so you have to keep the Beast busy whilst Otomai's Apprentice fixes the problem. Use your fighting skills to show it who's boss!

1342.nameId: Learn the Truth About the Beast
1342.descriptionId: This creature isn't the one Otomai's Apprentice was expecting... Talk to Jykel the Goblin and the apprentice to figure out what's going on.

1343.nameId: A Forewarned Iop Is not a Forearmed One
1343.descriptionId: There's something suspect about Yzua... Perhaps Rish Claymore at the Iop Temple will know something about this.

1344.descriptionId: You have boarded the Voyager to set sail for the holiday of your dreams on the archipelago of Vulkania. You should find out about the different tourist activities available.

1345.descriptionId: You have to capture Sauroshell souls and return them to Nevark the Hunter.

1346.descriptionId: You have to capture Sauroshell souls and return them to Nevark the Hunter.

1347.descriptionId: You have to capture Sauroshell souls and return them to Nevark the Hunter.

1348.descriptionId: You have to capture Sauroshell souls and return them to Nevark the Hunter.

1349.nameId: Little Pieces Scattered Around, Like a Puzzle
1349.descriptionId:
If you want to earn the right to enter the Pinki Crater, you will have to find the six pieces of Totem Erarious which have been hidden around Vulkania.
The enigmatic Matt Hematik will be only too happy to give you some clues if you don't know where to look.

1350.descriptionId: You have 15 minutes to gather as many shells as you can from the beaches of Vulkania. When this time has elapsed, you can take them to Thomas Cork in the hopes of earning a little reward.

1351.descriptionId: You have 15 minutes to gather as many shells as you can from the beaches of Vulkania. When this time has elapsed, you can take them to Thomas Cork in the hopes of earning a little reward.

1352.descriptionId: You have 15 minutes to gather as many shells as you can from the beaches of Vulkania. When this time has elapsed, you can take them to Thomas Cork in the hopes of earning a little reward.

1353.descriptionId: You have 15 minutes to gather as many shells as you can from the beaches of Vulkania. When this time has elapsed, you can take them to Thomas Cork in the hopes of earning a little reward.

1354.nameId: Sauroshells and Mussels, Alive Alive Oh
1354.descriptionId: You must finish this activity in order to earn the corresponding stamp from Thomas Cork.

1355.descriptionId: Tony Bleurgh, leader of the village of Vulkania, needs your help to find out who's responsible for a series of acts of sabotage. You'll have to collect samples from various suspects so that they can be thoroughly analysed. You're a pro crime scene investigator now, don't forget to put on your gloves before handling the evidence!

1356.descriptionId: You must finish this activity in order to earn the corresponding stamp from Nevark the Hunter.

1357.descriptionId: You must prove to Nevark the Hunter that you've got what it takes to be a real hunter.

1358.descriptionId: You must prove to Nevark the Hunter that you've got what it takes to be a real hunter.

1359.descriptionId: You must prove to Nevark the Hunter that you've got what it takes to be a real hunter.

1360.descriptionId: You must prove to Nevark the Hunter that you've got what it takes to be a real hunter.

1361.nameId: To Conquer the World, You Must Start in Its Bowels
1361.descriptionId: According to DuhBrane, your battle with Grozilla and Grasmera will end in stinging defeat. Do you think you're hard enough to prove him wrong?

1362.descriptionId: The moment of truth has arrived. To unmask the trouble-maker running riot all over Vulkania, you have to complete a CID analysis by placing the samples you took from the various suspects into the distillery. When you have the name of the perpetrator, all you'll have to do is go and worm the confession out of them and give them a good telling off.

1363.nameId: When the Bow Meow's Away, the Mimice Will Play
1363.descriptionId: Suze McGraff has seemed really on edge since her Bow Meow disappeared. If you want your sample, it'd be a good idea to find that old tomcat and bring him home, to get into her good books.

1364.descriptionId: Ivan Hartvigg may have once been a Professor, but now he has a seriously short memory, and he's forgotten the combination for the safe containing the recipe from the shop. Help him to put together the bits and pieces he does remember, and you'll be able to ask him for a sample in exchange.

1365.descriptionId: Defeat tired Grozilla and tired Grasmera to win one Madreggon Token.

1366.descriptionId: You have to catch the rare souls of Juvenile Sauroshells and take them to Nevark the Hunter.

1367.descriptionId: You have to catch the rare souls of Novice Sauroshells and take them to Nevark the Hunter.

1368.descriptionId: You have to catch the rare souls of Mature Sauroshells and take them to Nevark the Hunter.

1369.descriptionId: You have to catch the rare souls of Venerable Sauroshells and take them to Nevark the Hunter. Handing over the Sauroshell Shplinters is optional.

1370.descriptionId: Some graves have been vandalised: certain tombstones have been removed from the tombs. The warden doesn't know how to read, so he can't replace them himself. Help in the struggle against illiteracy, return dignity to the deceased and make the most of the situation to request a little sample at the same time.

1371.descriptionId: You must finish this activity to earn the corresponding stamp from Bonny Tyling.

1372.descriptionId: You must finish this activity to earn the corresponding stamp from Bonny Tyling.

1373.descriptionId: You must finish this activity to earn the corresponding stamp from Bonny Tyling.

1374.descriptionId: You must finish this activity to earn the corresponding stamp from Bonny Tyling.

1375.descriptionId: Stak wants to use mastic to plug up the holes in the damaged surfboards. He just needs Wriggly gumballs, and a good pumice stone. Find these things for him and perhaps he'll give you a little something in return...

1376.descriptionId: Catastrophe has struck! The Plimok reserve has been pillaged! You need to collect three types of salt and grind them down to obtain the precious powder used to prepare this local spice. Then you can ask Stok for the sample you need to continue your investigation.

1377.descriptionId: You need to interrogate the person you suspect of committing a number of atrocities around Vulkania, and make them confess. It's not that you doubt the CID's analysis, but there's nothing like hearing a good old-fashioned breakdown and confession, eh?

1378.descriptionId: Thanks to Charlie Endstown-Smisse's generosity, for once you don't have to shell out for a drink!

1380.descriptionId: After a close call with a breach of justice which would have plagued your conscience for the rest of your days, provided you have a conscience, you think you've identified the culprit. Now it's up to you to expose the truth once and for all... and to decide who hears about it.

1381.nameId: A Medal to Be Proud Of
1381.descriptionId: As a reward for all your hard work, Tony Bleurgh is pleased to present you with your very own Happy Camper Medal. No longer will people see you as a scrawny runt with no achievements to date! On the contrary, your tourist friends will be green with envy, which, when combined with their sunburn, will give them a beautiful tinge reminiscent of goosepats.

1382.descriptionId: Now you may beg the god Osamodas to accept your offering.

1383.descriptionId: Matt Hematik is the curious type. He has all sorts of questions about the beach located on Vulkania's northern coast. Why is it forbidden to the public? Is it really because of tourist-eating Raul Mops? He doesn't believe it for a second, because holiday-makers tend to hinder digestion. It's over to you to do some investigating and uncover the mystery of Tarada Bay!

1384.nameId: Go the Extra Mile with Charlie's Agents
1384.descriptionId: Betty Boom has recommended a little tour of Vulkania. Pull on your walking boots and get ready for a trek through some breath-takingly beautiful landscapes. Do remember to take regular breaths, though, and take care when peering into craters.

1385.descriptionId: To prove your devotion to your guardian deity, you should go and visit the dedicated temple.

1386.descriptionId: To prove your devotion to your guardian deity, you should go and visit the dedicated temple.

1387.descriptionId: To prove your devotion to your guardian deity, you should go and visit the dedicated temple.

1388.descriptionId: To prove your devotion to your guardian deity, you should go and visit the dedicated temple.

1389.descriptionId: To prove your devotion to your guardian deity, you should go and visit the dedicated temple.

1390.descriptionId: To prove your devotion to your guardian deity, you should go and visit the dedicated temple.

1391.descriptionId: To prove your devotion to your guardian deity, you should go and visit the dedicated temple.

1392.descriptionId: To prove your devotion to your guardian deity, you should go and visit the dedicated temple.

1393.descriptionId: To prove your devotion to your guardian deity, you should go and visit the dedicated temple.

1394.descriptionId: To prove your devotion to your guardian deity, you should go and visit the dedicated temple.

1395.descriptionId: To prove your devotion to your guardian deity, you should go and visit the dedicated temple.

1396.descriptionId: To prove your devotion to your guardian deity, you should go and visit the dedicated temple.

1397.descriptionId: To prove your devotion to your guardian deity, you should go and visit the dedicated temple.

1398.descriptionId: To prove your devotion to your guardian deity, you should go and visit the dedicated temple.

1400.descriptionId: Now you've seen all there is to see of Incarnam, it's time for you to start out on the long path to glory, fortune and the Dofus. The first step in this journey is to go to Astrub, the city of mercenaries and one of the most highly populated cities in the World of Twelve.

1401.descriptionId: You have to meet a few people who can tell you all about Astrub.

1402.nameId: A Tourist Who's Observant Is Worth Two in a Rush
1402.descriptionId: Guti Outsider has shown you all the important places to visit in Astrub.

1403.descriptionId: Guti Outsider has shown you the must-see commercial highlights of Astrub.

1404.nameId: On the Trail of the Dofus
1404.descriptionId: A stone in the Incarnam Temple is going to tell you the legend of Rykke Errel... and you will learn a bit more about the history of the Dofus.

1405.descriptionId: You're going to meet the most famous members of the Nhin family. As you will soon notice, these Enutrofs are the first to strike up a conversation. Some would even go as far as to say they're rather talkative, chatterboxes even. The Nhins shrug this off as idle gossip.

1406.descriptionId: Guti Outsider has advised you to speak to the mercenaries posted at the city gates to find out more about Astrub and its surrounding area.

1407.nameId: If You're Happy and in Astrub, Clap Your Hands...
1407.descriptionId: Guti Outsider thinks you'll need to visit the areas around Astrub yourself before you can form an opinion.

1408.descriptionId: You've decided to visit Brett Ernal to prove that death is just a passage.

1409.descriptionId: The gods tend to leave their stuff lying around in west Incarnam. It's no doubt because they want to make their presence felt and fuel their disciples' fervour. Or maybe they're just a bit distracted, who knows?

1410.descriptionId: Walt Saccurin is disturbing the Astrubians. Igor Ant has asked you to make him stop.

1411.descriptionId: Head toward the sun rise if you want to see other places which bear the marks of the gods. But don't lean too far over the Incarnam passages if you don't want to be taken for something dropped by them yourself.

1412.descriptionId: Igor Ant wants to prove to the inhabitants of Astrub that their safety is assured both inside and outside the city, including in the underground passages. Now, you're going to have to do a little more than just stand there looking scary.

1413.descriptionId: Igor Ant has suggested you meet some people who might be more likely to help you out in visiting the various local dungeons.

1414.descriptionId: At Karl Spodelair's request, you have to massacre a field of flowers.

1415.descriptionId: Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to kill as many Snappers as you can find in the creeks of Astrub

1416.descriptionId: You have the opportunity to learn more about the conflicts between adventurers by talking to Snori Nairb.

1418.descriptionId: Ant Emicheun doesn't think the extermination was effective enough. You'll have to kill even more Sick Grossewer Milirats.

1419.descriptionId: Ant Emicheun thinks the magic performed by the Sick Grossewer Shamans is partly responsible for the increased number of rats in the Astrub underground tunnels. He's asked you to get rid of as many of them as you can to avoid an outbreak.

1420.descriptionId: There are some life-changing events that stay in the memories of those who experience them forever: the death of a loved one, tax increases, your first exploration of a dungeon... and meeting Djaycy is another one of these unforgettable moments. Enjoy it, it don't dwell on it too much: you don't want to end up like him, do you?

1421.descriptionId: Vegeman needs help to keep his veggies safe.

1422.descriptionId: Shaa Kwira has suggested that you volunteer your services to the captain in order to get a taste of the joys of discipline and old-school camaraderie. Don't worry, you don't have to wear a uniform.

1423.descriptionId: Igor Ant wants you to see how Edgg Komb's getting on with his prisoners.

1424.descriptionId: Igor Ant has suggested you meet Metamunch Kin so he can give you some new challenges. Before you talk to him though, you need to mark down any of the Astrubian salesmen who are auctioning off their shabby equipment at the zaap.

1425.descriptionId: You have to complete a few missions for the Kerub militia.

1426.descriptionId: Once you've completed your service with the Kerubs, you should go back and see Struk'tohr Nhin to tell him what you think about the Incarnam militia. The old Enutrof might even have a new challenge to offer you...

1427.descriptionId: Gone are the days of leisurely walks through the countryside, afternoon naps by canals and long nights spent at the taverns drinking lemonade: it's time to get down to serious business. The dangers of Incarnam Dungeon await you on firmer ground.

1429.descriptionId: It's time to do the rounds of the harvesting professions' workshops and markets.

1430.descriptionId: It's time to do the rounds of the food makers' workshops and markets.

1431.descriptionId: It's time to do the rounds of the weapon makers' workshops and markets.

1432.descriptionId: It's time to do the rounds of the clothes and accessories makers' workshops and markets.

1433.descriptionId: It's time to go and take a look at the handymen's market.

1434.descriptionId: You have to go and meet another member of the Nhin family. You're going to have to walk, and even run, to do it. But since you love exercise and fresh air, it's not a chore at all!

1435.descriptionId: Crippled Nhin needs water for his craftsmen.

1436.descriptionId: It's time you met Hel Munster to learn more about smithmagic.

1437.descriptionId: To round off your tour of the area, Guti Outsider has given you a list of places to visit and people to meet in Amakna village.

1438.descriptionId: Poss'Ybel Nhin has invented a revolutionary bag that's light to carry and very elegant. She'd be happy to make you one, but you'll need to help her in the process. What wouldn't you do for fashion?

1439.descriptionId: Adviser Arky wants to see you.

1440.descriptionId: Crippled Nhin is overworked and he wants you to deliver a letter to Angela Decko, who runs the Astrubian Profession Information Centre. You also need to get 10 pinches of Temporal Powder: maybe Crippled wants to use this mixture to make up some time.

1441.descriptionId: You have decided to help Raymond Santho to fight World hunger.

1442.descriptionId: You have decided to carry on helping Raymond Santho.

1443.descriptionId: There are problems in the Astrub Fields, and it would seem your work for Raymond Santho is implicated in some way. You're going to have to repair the damage.

1444.descriptionId: Emia Elliesol is counting on Magus Ax's help to solve her problems, and you're acting as an intermediary.

1445.descriptionId: Once more, Emia Elliesol is counting on Magus Ax to find a solution to her problems and you will, once again, act as a go-between.

1446.nameId: All's Well That Ends, Well, with a Beer
1446.descriptionId: Found Fragments IV tells the story of the genesis of the Dofus. Any self-respecting adventurer will have read this book, if they want to shine in society. At least, that's what Acidrik will tell you between pints.

1447.descriptionId: Your going to meet a priest who converses with the other side. I wouldn't hold out much hope of being able to ask your dead ancestors where they hid the family treasures. Nistracolamus will remain deaf to your prayers... as long as you're alive, in any case.

1448.descriptionId: Visiting libraries is a rich source of information. You're confident you'll learn a bit more about the invasion of the demon Esra'Ruoy'Dnim and about King Allister's rise to the throne.

1449.descriptionId: Reginator has demanded that you resolve his fashion crisis.

1450.descriptionId: If you want to visit the whole of the Wabbit Islands, you'll need to get hold of a remedy for myxomawosis from one of Otomai's disciples who's staying in Amakna Village.

1451.descriptionId: You have agreed to help the Lenalds in their fight against the Wabbits.

1452.descriptionId: You have agreed to help the Lenalds in their fight against the Wabbits.

1453.descriptionId: You've agreed to help the Lenalds in their struggle against the Wabbits.

1454.descriptionId: You've agreed to help the Lenalds in their struggle against the Wabbits.

1455.descriptionId: You've agreed to help the Lenalds in their struggle against the Wabbits.

1456.nameId: It Never Wains But It Pouws
1456.descriptionId: Wanald the Wise Lenald has shown you how to get into the Wa Wabbit's Castle.

1457.descriptionId: You've made it into the Wa Wabbit's Castle. Now all you have to do is find the monarch and defeat him.

1458.descriptionId: Wanald the Wise Lenald has explained how to steal the Cawwot Dofus.

1459.descriptionId: You need to find a few raw materials to help the island's Lenalds survive.

1460.descriptionId: Fixou might just have a solution for the Wabbit problem and has asked for your help to find the missing ingredients.

1461.descriptionId: You need to use a syringe to inject Fixou's potion into growing Cawwots.

1462.descriptionId: Where did the Skeleton Wabbits come from? As puzzling as the question may be, you have to answer it!

1463.descriptionId: The children of the World of Twelve need YOU! You have to restock the Iced Chestnut supply room so that the Goblimps have the energy to work and create all the toys needed for a successful Kwismas.

1464.descriptionId: Every time you help Vlad the Blimpaler, you can earn one Good Point. Collect enough and you'll get a Workshop Star.

1465.descriptionId: Once you've collected 6 Kwismas Stars, you can get a Caged Slayhound from Leo. Warning, the animal will only agree to leave his cage on certain conditions. Once he's out, though, he'll be as loyal as he is lethal!

1466.descriptionId: It's Kwismas time, and everyone should be rejoicing! But some people just don't get it - as well as being glum, they're stealing from the storeroom, and that's not on! That's why Scooger wants you to go and see Blimpristed the Shivery.

1467.descriptionId: It's Kwismas time, and everyone should be rejoicing! But some people just don't get it - as well as being glum, they're stealing from the storeroom, and that's not on! That's why Scooger wants you to go and see Redolph the Red-Nose.

1468.descriptionId: It's Kwismas time, and everyone should be rejoicing! But some people just don't get it - as well as being glum, they're stealing from the storeroom, and that's not on! That's why Scooger wants you to go and see Roachelf.

1469.nameId: Oogie Betty Is a Grinchy Grump
1469.descriptionId: It's Kwismas time, and everyone should be rejoicing! But some people just don't get it - as well as being glum, they're stealing from the storeroom, and that's not on! That's why Scooger wants you to go and see Oogie Betty.

1470.descriptionId: Scooger will award you this star if you bring him several bags of loot stolen by the grumps. If you manage to get hold of it, the boss'll love you!

1471.descriptionId: Bring back the bags of loot that Blimpristed has stolen and Scooger will swap them with Gussets which you can use to get elements of the Goblimp set!

1472.nameId: Redolph Has Something Up His Nose
1472.descriptionId: Bring back the bags of loot that Redolph has stolen and Scooger will swap them with Red Noses which you can use to get elements of the Redolph set!

1473.nameId: Roachelf Has His Feelers in a Twist
1473.descriptionId: Bring back the bags of loot that Roachelf has stolen and Scooger will swap them with Antennae which you can use to get elements of the Kwismas Nightmare set!

1474.nameId: Oogie Betty Ought to Brace Herself for a Shock
1474.descriptionId: Bring back the bags of loot that Oogie Betty has stolen and Scooger will swap them with Braces which you can use to get elements of the Kwismas Nightmare set!

1475.descriptionId: The Thwee Kings need your help to face their nemesis.

1476.descriptionId: The Thwee Kings' lives are danger thanks to L.O. Athsome. You've agreed to help them defend themselves.

1477.descriptionId: Blimpilator has sent you to see Balt Hasaw and check his ammo stocks.

1478.descriptionId: You have to warn Mel Chiow of the danger he's in.

1479.descriptionId: You have to produce a toy and give it to Nicholas Kwismas in order to access his shops.

1480.descriptionId: You have to beat the Itzting and take its star.

1481.descriptionId: Harry Kwismas will give you the Dungeon Star if you complete the "Kwismas Preparations" quest three times by fighting the guardian of the dungeon he has chosen.

1482.descriptionId: Some dreadful creatures have burgled Father Kwismas's warehouse. You need to get back the boxes of gifts that they've stolen - with or without their consent - and return them to Harry Kwismas.

1483.descriptionId: Some dreadful creatures have burgled Father Kwismas's warehouse. You need to get back the boxes of gifts that they've stolen - with or without their consent - and return them to Harry Kwismas.

1484.descriptionId: Some dreadful creatures have burgled Father Kwismas's warehouse. You need to get back the boxes of gifts that they've stolen - with or without their consent - and return them to Harry Kwismas.

1485.descriptionId: Some dreadful creatures have burgled Father Kwismas's warehouse. You need to get back the boxes of gifts that they've stolen - with or without their consent - and return them to Harry Kwismas.

1486.descriptionId: Some dreadful creatures have burgled Father Kwismas's warehouse. You need to get back the boxes of gifts that they've stolen - with or without their consent - and return them to Harry Kwismas.

1487.descriptionId: Some dreadful creatures have burgled Father Kwismas's warehouse. You need to get back the boxes of gifts that they've stolen - with or without their consent - and return them to Harry Kwismas.

1488.descriptionId: Some dreadful creatures have burgled Father Kwismas's warehouse. You need to get back the boxes of gifts that they've stolen - with or without their consent - and return them to Harry Kwismas.

1489.descriptionId: Some dreadful creatures have burgled Father Kwismas's warehouse. You need to get back the boxes of gifts that they've stolen - with or without their consent - and return them to Harry Kwismas.

1490.nameId: But Why Is He So Mean?
1490.descriptionId: You have to find a way to get into Blimpristed the Shivery's cave. Only then will you see him tremble before you.

1491.descriptionId: Zam Bono, a shady Rogue known for causing trouble around Astrub, has stolen Blimpilator's notebook. You absolutely must get this notebook back. Zam is the sneaky, dishonest type, so stay vigilant and don't make a pig's ear of this!

1492.descriptionId: Before you get the hooklet that will allow you to sneak into Blimpristed's cave, you're going to have to tighten a few screws. You should think about taking a long bath afterwards, to get rid of the persistent odour which has been following you since Amakna.

1493.descriptionId: Redolph's fondness for drinking is at the root of a fair few problems, but it might also be the key to getting him to open his stable door to you. Get your travel bag ready, it might be quite a journey.

1494.descriptionId: After your journey to Moon Island, you have to go back to Madrestam to give the keg of rum to Shuga Kane, as agreed. Hopefully, everything will go just as planned...

1495.nameId: What Shall We Do with the Drunken Sailor?
1495.descriptionId: Apparently Redolph's incessant drunkenness has become contagious... It's up to you to hunt down some Snowballs to bring Hiseze back down to earth.

1496.descriptionId: You need to get hold of the key to Roachelf's loft so you can go and have a talk with the terrible beast. Would it be wrong, would it be right, if you took his life tonight? Chances are that you might.

1497.descriptionId: Some Abominable Snow Yitis appear to have a pronounced taste for fresh flesh and reading. Unless perhaps they used the diary's pages to wrap up the meat before eating it?

1498.descriptionId: You've set off for Otomai Island to try to find the key to the mystery... and to Roachelf's loft while you're at it.

1499.descriptionId: Before you have the honour of paying Oogie Betty a visit, you're going to have to find the key to her ice sanctuary. Something tells you it's not going to be all fun and games, and that you'll have to play rough to succeed...

1500.descriptionId: After a whole load of training, Blimpboa is ready to fight! Adrienne wants to give him the thumbs up of encouragement he needs to succeed... so she's going to need you to give her a hand.

1501.descriptionId: Adrienne has thought up a marvellous scheme to prevent Blimpboa from getting his butt kicked by a Pandikaze full of fermeted bamboo milk. Now it's time for you to become... the gastric trouble-makers!

1502.descriptionId: Rushing around during the festive season is good for you! Of course, you're probably going to look pretty silly with your staff out and your oranges frozen, but since when did you care what people thought of you?

1503.descriptionId: By playing the Goblimps' staff placing game, you can earn 20 Beside the Points. It'll be tiring, but just remember that there's a Jokey Goblimp Star waiting at the end of it, just for you.

1505.descriptionId: Show Harry Kwismas what you can do and he'll give you a natural tonic.

1506.descriptionId: Your final mission: protect a Wabbit relic against the enemies of the kingdom. King Allister is counting on you!

1507.descriptionId: Your final mission: steal a Wabbit relic offered to the kingdom of Amakna. The head of the Rogues is counting on you!

1508.descriptionId: As you have probably noticed, Uba Tesse has transformed you into a Wabbit. Go back to the castle to act as bait, and do your best to get any enemies of the kingdom of Amakna out of the way while you're at it.

1509.descriptionId: Something is worrying Metamunch Kin and apparently it's all your fault. The Key Master might know how to get to the bottom of this.

1510.nameId: Don't Judge a Book by Its Cover
1510.descriptionId: Prent the Goblin really wants you to check out the engravings done for one of Herdegrize the Mystic's books. You can't wait to add these pieces to your collection of religious paintings.

1535.descriptionId: Lou Bricante would like to know what's going on in the Sakai Mine Dungeon.

1536.descriptionId: A pacifistic Wabbit has asked you to find a sacred book detailing the Gweat Wabbit's Prophecy. What you wouldn't do for a handful of Cawwots...

1537.descriptionId: Defeat sleepwalking Grozilla and sleepwalking Grasmera to win one Krolimea Token.

1538.descriptionId: Defeat exhausted Grozilla and exhausted Grasmera to win four Krolimea Tokens.

1539.descriptionId: Defeat Grozilla and Grasmera to win four Madreggon Tokens.

1540.descriptionId: According to DuhBrane, your battle with Grozilla and Grasmera will end in stinging defeat. Do you think you're hard enough to prove him wrong?

1541.nameId: In Search of A Lost Time
1541.descriptionId: Jeff Stobbs has amnesia. As you have nothing better to do, you have decided to help him find his memory. Yup, that's just what you're like. After all, it's incredibly frustrating watching someone on the go-slow just because of a memory problem.

1542.descriptionId: You must go to the Jeez Crater and exterminate some Raw Juvenile Sauroshells.

1543.descriptionId: You must go to the Onthea Crater and exterminate some Raw Novice Sauroshells there.

1544.descriptionId: You must go to the Paleozoi Crater and exterminate some Raw Mature Sauroshells there.

1545.descriptionId: You must go to the Mountsaleia Crater and exterminate some Raw Venerable Sauroshells there.

1546.descriptionId: You must kill 5 of each type of Juvenile Sauroshell in the Traktopel Forest.

1547.descriptionId: You must kill 5 of each type of Novice Sauroshell in the Spartania Forest.

1548.descriptionId: You must kill 5 of each type of Mature Sauroshell in the Stratigra Forest.

1549.descriptionId: You must kill 5 of each type of Venerable Sauroshell in the Ponifar Forest.

1550.descriptionId: Huckle Ingon has asked you to soil the Otomaisle flag in order to earn your place on the Vulkorog team.

1551.descriptionId: Seamus Tard has asked you to soil the Vulkorog flag in order to earn your place on the Otomaisle team.

1552.descriptionId: After having discovered Sauroshell Heart trafficking, you have decided to take advantage of the opportunities laid out before you. Your creditors will only congratulate you!

1553.descriptionId: You must gather the rock crystals scattered around on Vulkania Island.

1554.descriptionId: You have agreed to help an Ecaflip win a kinda stupid bet (aren't all bets stupid?). Get your thinking cap on and prepare for a little bit of maths. Don't forget to consult your notes as soon as they're complete. Matt Hematik's help will prove particularly useful, especially if you don't know how to add 2 and 2 together... If your answers really don't seem to add up, go and double check with Bo Pye that the bet's still on!

1555.descriptionId: Your mission, which you've already accepted, is to help the Foggernauts solve the mystery of the monster in Astrub Pond. It's almost certainly not a Giant Kralove who has chosen to live in this body of water, but you never know... You might catch a glimpse of the Loch Ness Monstuna.

1556.descriptionId: To prove your devotion to your guardian deity, you should go and visit the dedicated temple.

1557.descriptionId: If you defeat the Dopple, the master of combat will reward you.

1558.descriptionId: Your mission is to see how many pearls you can obtain from Sufokian shells. Your harvest will be used to prepare a slightly salty, pickly vinegar. Yum!

1559.descriptionId: Off you go, hunting for Scaraleaves so you can make some delicious treats with their eggs. OK, so you have no idea what they taste like... But who cares? You're an adventurer, you only eat dry bread and Shigekax anyway.

1560.nameId: Don't Give Up Your Reap Job
1560.descriptionId: Vasca Degamo needs competent professionals to fill his reserves. Seeing as you're a farmer and you've got resources aplenty, you've offered to help out.

1561.nameId: Don't Give Up Your Chop Job
1561.descriptionId: Vasca Degamo needs competent professionals to fill his reserves. Seeing as you're a lumberjack and you've got resources aplenty, you've offered to help out.

1562.nameId: Don't Give Up Your Mine Job
1562.descriptionId: Vasca Degamo needs competent professionals to fill his reserves. Seeing as you're a miner and you've got resources aplenty, you've offered to help out.

1563.nameId: Don't Give Up Your Pick Job
1563.descriptionId: Vasca Degamo needs competent professionals to fill his reserves. Seeing as you're an alchemist and you've got resources aplenty, you've offered to help out.

1564.nameId: Don't Give Up Your Fish Job
1564.descriptionId: Vasca Degamo needs competent professionals to fill his reserves. Seeing as you're a fisherman and you've got resources aplenty, you've offered to help out.

1565.nameId: Don't Give Up Your Hunt Job
1565.descriptionId: Vasca Degamo needs competent professionals to fill his reserves. Seeing as you're a hunter and you've got resources aplenty, you've offered to help out.

1566.descriptionId: Your mission, should you choose to accept, is to crush the Jellies on the peninsula in order to make a concentrated juice. Any colour should do the trick.

1567.descriptionId: Have a wander around the new Sufokia and feel free to travel using the Wind Zaapis if you're pushed for time... unless you'd prefer to take a stroll around the quays. Try not to fall in the water, though. We don't want the other cities catching wind of someone drowning - it just doesn't bode well, you know?

1568.descriptionId: Commander Costo sees you for the hero that you are, who's ready to defend widow, orphan and Grawn Fritter. Today's mission, should you choose to accept, is to slice to pieces the vagabonds that kick around on Bandit Territory, to the north of Sufokia.

1570.descriptionId: Lily has asked you to hunt down some Wabbits to deter them from attacking her ship.

1571.descriptionId: Magus Ax is not only an alchemist, theologian, professor of magic and master of astral journeys; he's also a dab hand with a quill. He'd make a brilliant enyclopaedia seller. The proof? He convinced you to accept that his almanac concept was worth going out of your way for - that's why you're going to head to the Lousy Pig Plain to find out more.

1572.descriptionId: During each of your daily visits to the Almanax Sanctuary, you'll be able to pick up a Calendar Page if you honour that day's Meridia. When you have 365, Antyklime Ax will reward you with an exceptional gift: the Dolmanax, an authentic dragon egg. A year spent travelling around the four corners of the World of Twelve... It's not too much to pay for a Dofus. The challenge? You're more used to brandishing blunt slicing instruments than arming yourself with patience.

1573.descriptionId: Today is the day of the Meridia of Forgetfulness. Antyklime Ax has asked you to make an offering. You accepted. It's always a good idea to grace a god, irrelevant of his importance.

1574.descriptionId: Today is the day of the Meridia of Stability. Antyklime Ax has asked you to make an offering. You accepted. It's always a good idea to grace a god, irrelevant of his importance.

1575.descriptionId: Today is the day of the Meridia of Collaboration. Antyklime Ax has asked you to make an offering. You accepted. It's always a good idea to grace a god, irrelevant of his importance.

1576.descriptionId: Today is the day of the Meridia of the Forests. Antyklime Ax has asked you to make an offering. You accepted. It's always a good idea to grace a god, irrelevant of his importance.

1577.descriptionId: Today is the day of the Meridia of the Tides. Antyklime Ax has asked you to make an offering. You accepted. It's always a good idea to grace a god, irrelevant of his importance.

1680.descriptionId: Your mission is to run around Astrub raking through carts to find stolen items. Hey, it makes a change from ferreting around in bins all the time!

1681.descriptionId: There are some cheeky archers running amok at All Arrows Eve. You kind of get the bum deal in all this, as your job is to stop them. Save the behinds of the Api collectors, and no buts!

1682.descriptionId: The final of the Brakmarathon is the chance for all the dark city's inhabitants to show their, um, sportsmanship. If you don't step in, the chances are that none of the competitors will even reach the finish line!

1812.descriptionId: Some nasty bakers want to ruin Fanny Eppy's festivities: pretend to be a health inspector and make sure that no one is poisoned by their scheming plans.

1813.descriptionId: Scramble Pegg the chef has got you in a right mess: he's talked you into going out to collect some Kwak eggs whilst he continues selling his grub. Fleaster has put you in a good mood, but this really takes the biscuit! All the same, even if it doesn't earn you any kamas, you're pretty sure a walk through Crackler country will do you good.

1814.descriptionId: Bill Krosby will have a reward for you if you win at least one game of Krosmaster today.

1815.descriptionId: You've decided to set off on the hunt for Rabmajokes on behalf of a collection-mad goblin. They say that these stories are so funny they even make Brumaire and Raval laugh. That's probably an exaggeration, but who can resist the belly-aching humour of Rabmarac?

1816.descriptionId: Although you're not the best at housework, you've agreed to help Kerub restore a magical feather duster. It might not seem as wonderful as repairing a broken legendary sword, but just you try to fight against dust with a legendary sword. If you're not a Iop, you'll realise quite early on that you're probably not going to win!

1817.descriptionId: It's true that Kerub Crepin's hairs are a magical resource that craftsman will clutch at with both hands. To get some without bothering their guardian, you've accepted the job of giving a few naughty Xelors a good beating.

1818.descriptionId: Kerub Crepin needs your help to conduct an investigation into the presence of a Shushu hunter in Astrub.

1882.descriptionId: Head chef Kaisa Sozepan is going mad: Goblins are attacking her apprentices right in the middle of the preparation of the royal banquet! Save the Maysial Munch! That way, you'll be able to say that, for once in your life, you acted in the name of good taste.

1883.nameId: Thwump, Thwump, Thwump in the Night
1883.descriptionId: Do you know how to plant Cawwots the same way Wabbits do? There's still time to learn... Apparently, the technique brings good luck, according to the eminent Guwu, at least. But are you ready to face Thwumper and risk being nipped in the bud?

1895.descriptionId: Brokkreitri needs you to collect some resources. You have a sneaking suspicion that it won't stop at that, either.

1896.descriptionId: Brokkreitri needs you to collect some resources. You have a sneaking suspicion that it won't stop at that, either.

1898.descriptionId: Bea Fortax needs you to collect some resources. You have a sneaking suspicion that it won't stop at that, either.

1899.descriptionId: Bea Fortax needs you to collect some resources. You have a sneaking suspicion that it won't stop at that, either.

1900.descriptionId: Bea Fortax needs you to collect some resources. You have a sneaking suspicion that it won't stop at that, either.

1901.descriptionId: Carla Garfield needs you to collect some resources. You have a sneaking suspicion that it won't stop at that, either.

1902.descriptionId: You have to craft a special suit before you can go and help the fisherman lost in the abysses of the Frozen Lake.

1903.descriptionId: You really should find some companions for your trip into the depths of the Frozen Lake.

1904.descriptionId: The Eco Flagship Company Agent was attacked near the boilers. He's asked you to investigate.

1905.descriptionId: Dolores Kimo has admitted that she taught certain sabotage methods to the lake workers. The investigation goes on.

1906.descriptionId: You've decided to pay a visit to the master craftsmen living in Harebourg's castle and wipe the floor with them whilst you're there. You're not sure why you embarked on this little venture, but the little voice in your head telling you to slaughter everything in your path is hardly a new arrival.

1907.descriptionId: Wes of Tubsterville's troops are no longer powerful enough to exterminate the creatures from Harebourg's castle. Darwin Chester is counting on you to lend a hand.

1908.descriptionId: Wes of Tubsterville's troops are no longer powerful enough to exterminate the creatures from Harebourg's castle. Darwin Chester is counting on you to lend a hand.

1909.descriptionId: Wes of Tubsterville's troops are no longer powerful enough to exterminate the creatures from Harebourg's castle. Darwin Chester is counting on you to lend a hand.

1910.descriptionId: Wes of Tubsterville's troops are no longer powerful enough to exterminate the creatures from Harebourg's castle. Darwin Chester is counting on you to lend a hand.

1911.descriptionId: Wes of Tubsterville's troops are no longer powerful enough to exterminate the creatures from Harebourg's castle. Darwin Chester is counting on you to lend a hand.

1912.descriptionId: Someone in the vicinity of Harebourg's castle must be interested in a Bottle of Cocalane. Your job is to find them.

1913.descriptionId: The person who lost their towel must be somewhere in the vicinity of Harebourg's castle. Your job is to find them.

1914.descriptionId: The owner of this Nose Hair G-String must be somewhere in the vicinity of Harebourg's castle. Your job is to find them.

1915.descriptionId: Someone in the vicinity of Harebourg's castle or the Snowbound Village must be interested in an Old Magazine. Your job is to find them.

1916.descriptionId: There must be some place in the vicinity of Harebourg's castle to post the Patent of Nobility. Your job is to find that place.

1917.descriptionId: You have to defeat Nileza and get out of his laboratory alive.

1918.descriptionId: You have to defeat Sylargh and get out of his carrier alive.

1919.descriptionId: You have to defeat Klime and get out of his private suite alive.

1920.nameId: A Missiz Freezz Hack and Slash
1920.descriptionId: You have to defeat Missiz Freezz and get out of her frostforge alive.

1921.nameId: A Count Harebourg Hack and Slash
1921.descriptionId: You have to defeat Count Harebourg and get out of his dungeon alive.

1922.descriptionId: King Allister wants to know why Frigost Island has re-established contact with the mainland after almost a century of silence.

1923.descriptionId: You have to find out more about the curse that led to Frigost's icy fate. You're going to meet a whole load of people on the way, so you can say goodbye to the lazy humdrum of your former life. Things are looking up, though: finally, you're working to support a cause. For mayor, community and personal gain!

1924.descriptionId: Mayor Cantile has voiced the question on everyone's lips: is there a way to lift Djaul's curse? She wants you to explore three specific routes of enquiry and see if they get you anywhere. In short, you're off to tramp around in the snow again.

1925.descriptionId: Mina Spirit has asked you to talk to the members of the Guard of the Day Without End and offer your assistance.

1926.descriptionId: Darwin Chester has asked you to find Professor Imagarihs.

1927.descriptionId: This is it. After trekking all around Frigost, this way and that, you've finally been dispatched to the most dangerous place on this frozen wasteland: Count Harebourg's castle! Who knows what might await you inside its icy walls? Don't forget to send a postcard to your drinking buddies back on the continent... This may well be the last they ever hear of you.

1928.descriptionId: You're finally ready to explore the Harebourg's Castle dungeon. At the end of your journey, the Count awaits you with his Water Clock and who knows what else. Something tells you the path that lies ahead will be littered with pitfalls and detours.

1929.descriptionId:
The 1001-Day Count is out for the count, and your mission is almost over. One last visit to Nileza, and all that will be left for you to do is to report back to Mayor Cantile and your employer.
Jiva hinted that your destiny would be linked to that of Frigost for evermore. What could she have meant? Perhaps you'll find out one day...

1930.descriptionId: You've dreamt of it for years, and now you're finally holding it in your hands... The legendary Ice Dofus. It's so powerful that it will keep your fermented Bamboo Milk cool, even in the middle of summer. Well worth the wait, then, eh?

1931.descriptionId: Awestruck by your presence, your powerful gait and your noble facial features, Sylpester has knelt before you to beg you to help the inhabitants of the Snowbound Village. Well... It wasn't quite like that, but that's the way you're going to describe it in your autobiography.

1932.descriptionId: Karla Shnikoff wants you to make yourself useful by going to join Sab O'Terr.

1933.descriptionId: You're overcome by a sudden urge to whack Count Harebourg one just to calm your nerves. Unless you don't feel like making him pay for all the time you've spent slaying monsters just to get to the top of his tower...?

1934.descriptionId: The creature must be captured and then locked away in the Guard of the Day Without End's tower

1935.descriptionId: Wes of Tubsterville is counting on you to capture the elite fighters working for the master craftsmen.

1936.nameId: Find the Creature and Bring It Back
1936.descriptionId: Some people claim they've heard Doctor Gobotnegg cackling on Sakai Island. He's wanted for assault on organic beings.

1937.nameId: If Only I Could Turn Off Time
1937.descriptionId: Ever since the start of the eternal winter, time has been frozen on Frigost. If Hazieff Taroun's hypothesis is correct, this situation was bound to collapse at some point... and the prospect of all his frozen time catching up with him at once doesn't seem to make him feel very optimistic. You need to enlist the help of some chronomagic experts to ensure that Harebourg's Water Clock remains stable.

1938.descriptionId: The Guard of the Day Without End is responsible for keeping an eye on all that happens within Harebourg Castle. The Guards' members form a slim but solid barricade against the threat posed by the Count's henchmen... The Guard must not fail. Joining this elite squad would be quite an honour! You would finally be able to tell your parents you'd done something with your life. I mean, running around like a headless Piwi, slaying monsters and camping out at marketplaces... Is that really what you want to do for the rest of your life?

1939.descriptionId: Welcome to your first mission as a recruit-to-be for the Guard of the Day Without End. How does a little walk along the ramparts of Harebourg's crib sound? Clench your teeth and your buttocks and everything will be just fine. Or that's what you keep telling yourself.

1940.descriptionId: Wes of Tubsterville wants to put your fighting skills to the test. This could be the opportunity you've been waiting for to add a few new monsters to your list of conquests!

1941.descriptionId: The chances are that Sylargh the Imp is plotting something, and you want to get to the bottom of it. To do so, you'll have to decipher the message you intercepted. Yep, here on Frigost, the bad guys are smart as well as evil. It makes a change!

1942.descriptionId: Klime the Shoemaker is involved in Missiz Freezz's diabolical plans. Cut him down to size by stitching him up good and proper.

1943.descriptionId: You've given Sylargh's ears a tug and dished out a good walloping to Klime, so you know who's next: Missiz Freezz the Smithmagus. Afterwards, you can take a well-earned rest. It's up to you whether it's in an inn or a cemetery.

1944.descriptionId: Wes of Tubsterville has asked you to find his little girl.

1945.descriptionId: The creature must be captured and locked away in the Guard of the Day Without End's tower.

1946.descriptionId: The creature must be captured and locked away in the Guard of the Day Without End's tower.

1947.descriptionId: The creature must be captured and locked away in the Guard of the Day Without End's tower.

1948.descriptionId: The creature must be captured and locked away in the Guard of the Day Without End's tower.

1949.descriptionId: Mina Spirit is counting on you to see the exorcism goes as planned.

1950.descriptionId: Hazieff Taroun is worried about his friend Gus Bump. Find him!

1951.descriptionId: Wes of Tubsterville is taking Emma Skulated's kidnapping and the betrayal of someone in the Guard to heart. You started this investigation... Now you've got to finish it.
